Reviews.Title: “review asked for.”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte R Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Small clean rooms, helpful staff in reception, excellent wifi. Easy to reach and start exploring NY by subway. Nice breakfast places close, at Amsterdam Avenue. Thanks and see You again, already sent You other guests :-) !

Reviews.AuthorLocation: White Plains, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed in accept my advise and do't go there”
Reviews.Author: Ali S
Reviews.Content: the room service is only service available and poor, watch your belongings when you go out. there is no phone even if you want to pay so if you don't have a cell do not go there, the web rate was 120 and one extra night they made me pay 250 and when I wanted to go to another hotel they said it's 12:05 you have to pay 75 dollar as soon as I wanted to get ready it become 1:03 and it become ONE FULL DAY now I had no way!!! I had problem with their internet and they gave me such a hard time. this hotel seems to be in the hand of some private Indian firm not a legitimate american or European this people are horrible so rude so unhelpful I hated my stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Small Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Ellas2011
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great quiet location (Upper West Side, Manhattan). It is a 3 min walk to the subway (86th Street) and about a 10 minute walk to Central Park. The area is filled with some great cafes, breakfast diners and restaurants. If you feel adventurous you can walk to Times Square, which took us approximately 45 minutes. Everything you hear about the rooms is true. They were the smallest rooms I have ever seen and they include a bed, two small side tables and very little walking space. If you are sharing the room with someone, it will feel like a crammed obstacle course as you are constantly jumping over bags and your luggage. The washroom is also very small. Overall the place is clean, the staff was polite and approachable and the price was reasonable for the location (we got a great deal online). If you need a lot of space in your hotel room, this is not the place for you. If you don’t spend much time in your room since you are exploring this amazing city, then this hotel is a decent option. FYI - parking is half a block away and will cost you $35 a night (hotel discount rate).

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: LuvsTOOTravel
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to the city and we were thrilled to find such a great place to stay. It was so incredibly convenient to the subway, great places to eat in the area, and our room was always extremel clean. The room was small but we felt very cozy and we really didn't spend much time in our room at all. We stayed out late every night and slept in every morning until 9 or 10am and it was always nice and quiet. We always felt safe walking back to the hotel after a late night out. We definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible.”
Reviews.Author: lizwall
Reviews.Content: The room was way over priced for the area and the rooms where incredibly small. They do not have conditioner. Also there is some type of machine that makes the room vibrate. I have been in new York for a little of a week and only one night was spent here. For the price of one night here I could stay in time square for two nights. Big disappoint!!

Reviews.Title: “Small but affordable great stay”
Reviews.Author: Sophia V
Reviews.Content: Stayed at belnord in December 2011. Me and my boyfriend we stayed here for four nights.I must say that the rooms are small but they are modern and clean. Flat screen t.v and clean towels.I would stay here again and recommend this stay.it's really affordable and staff was help full.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy cleaning crew”
Reviews.Author: Tres Chic B
Reviews.Content: 1) clean room & bathroom 2) considered spacious for a NY hotel especially Upper West Side area 3) DO NOT stay if you need to sleep in. I can't sleep past 8pm because the cleaning crew was talking extra loud to each other, and making so much noise banging their equipment, closing doors, and it happened every day. 4) And even though they clean the bathroom, they never scrub the tub, so at the end of our stay the tub becomes extremely slippery. 5) If you need reception to call a cab for you, make sure you mention yellow cab, because they called an expensive town car for us, so they can get commission.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jerjerDublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: I had a quick stay in New York before returning home and chose this because of the price. I was extremely disappointed with it. The room was tiny (not an issue really) but the biggest issue was the noise. There was a generator or something under my room which started every hour, all through the night and kept waking me up. Also, anyone who happened to be on the corridor outside the room could be heard as if they were in the room beside me. Very unimpressed with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pay attention”
Reviews.Author: Lollo74
Reviews.Content: Instead of a double room, they rent a single room. I' ve never seen in my life an hotel room so small. The position is good but it's really overpriced considering the quality of the room! The bed is a little bit bigger than a single bed and the bath has no heater. The wi fi connection works good but i don't find any reasons to suggest or to come again.

Reviews.Title: “I suggest to spend slightly more for something much better.”
Reviews.Author: Brandon H
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I had stayed here. This time was much worse, and will be my last. The rooms are small, but I think theyre fine for 1 or 2 people. It's New York, so you're unlikely to be in your room much anyway. They are also very clean. I will give them that. There is a station which shows XXX content on it in each room. Id suggest parents with kids be careful about this. I cant remember the channel name, sorry. There is free wi-fi in the room, which is good. However, sometimes it's fast and sometimes it's very slow. There are public 3 computers and 1 printer available to use for a small fee. Also, my mobile phone and no signal in my room. I was on the first floor so maybe thats it? It was aggravating whatever the reason. The bed wasnt very soft, quite firm in my opinion. So, depending on how you like your bed to be, this can be good or bad. The AC/heat in the room was VERY, VERY loud. I couldnt turn it on at night to sleep. Therefore, when I woke up it was cold in my room. One of the worst things about this place is the shower. It gets very cold all of a sudden....then you get scalded. I like a good, warm shower that stays warm for 10 mins or less. This was AWFUL. The walls are very thin, so if you're a light sleeper like I am. BEWARE. I couldnt sleep well at night. A poor nights sleep really wears on you when you're running all around the city. The staff are unfriendly and act like they'd prefer if you werent there. My bathroom had a leak dropping from the overhead vent. It soaked the floor. I went to the front desk to ask if I could change my room. He acted like it made him angry to have to deal with this. He said he'd send someone to fix it. Why couldnt I just get a different room with a dry floor? The guy came, said "It's because the people above you were taking a shower. It will stop in 5 mins. Keep the towels on the floor and where it's dropping." He gave me clean towels and left. It did stop dripping but the floor remained wet 'til I checked out the next day. This is HORRIBLE customer service regardless if you're a budget hotel or not. I'd suggest that you spend $50.00 more a night and actually have an enjoyable place to stay. I travel to NYC 2-3 times a year. I will never stay at this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for two or less in NYC”
Reviews.Author: crazistevo
Reviews.Content: The rooms are tiny(but how much time do you really spend in your room when visiting NYC) The bathrooms are efficient(shower was nice and hot) The bed literally takes up the entire room, there is a closet and drawer to store things(do not leave your car keys in the drawer like we did) Wifi was decent.. Fantastic location, quiet neighborhood, quick one minute walk to the subway(you must cross broadway to go downtown) The prices were fantastic for NYC.. Its a winner in our book, and we will be back next visit..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in a small package!”
Reviews.Author: texandi
Reviews.Content: A small gem on the upper west side. Rooms and barhrooms are very small, but clean, comfortable and modern, The property looks recently remodeled. Great location, quiet, convenient. No breakfast, but Starbucks and Coffee Bean within a block.

Reviews.Title: “Nice conveinent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: oromariposa
Reviews.Content: I went to NYC for a weekend visit. The rooms are quite small but the cleanliness of the hotel and the location make up for that. There are numerous restaurants in close vicinity and the subway to Times Square and other points of interest is only a block away. I would stay there again. The only negative thing was the internet was very weak and was completely down my last day there.But there is a Starbucks around the corner

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: attyjc
Reviews.Content: my husband and I stayed here for three days and two nights. although the room was quite small for two people, it was not really a big deal for me because it was nevertheless comfortable and we were usually out the whole day, we really only needed a place and bed to sleep at at night. The location was great, it was a few seconds walk to Broadway Street where you can easily spot various shops and restaurants. It is likewise a few minutes (or even seconds, depending on your pacing) to a Subway station which can take you to Times Square via the 50th Avenue. It is likewise very very close to the Central Park, I even just walked my way back to the hotel when I visited Central Park. Moreover, the hotel offers free WiFi service, all you have to do is ask the front desk people. The hotel is excellent and I would recommend this to anyone who is lookin for a place to stay in new york city. there is definitely a big chance that I would check in this hotel on my next visit to new york. (never mind the not so friendly front desk people, doesnt really matter, the hotel was already fine enough)

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: Miiszcupcake
Reviews.Content: I have used this hotel about 20 times... Yes if you get a regular room it is very small basically only fits the bed with minimal walking space. I have also stayed in a family suite which was huge ! almost like an apartment and is not that much more in price. The hotel is extremely quite, the staff is nice , and it is very cheap at times i have found a room for $80 alot of the time you just have to keep checking.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for a Single Person”
Reviews.Author: cc1715
Reviews.Content: The room would be just right if you are traveling alone and you get a room with twin beds. Otherwise there is nowhere to put your stuff. The hotel is located in a nice neighborhood and it is clean. Shopping, dining and sight-seeing are convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel delivers what you pay for it”
Reviews.Author: Felipe C
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location, but the rooms are the smallest I have ever seen, its even smaller than a ship cabin. Service is poor, with rude reception employees, but the hotel is clean and its 1 block away from a subway station. So, if you want a cheap hotel in Manhattan, and won't care about the hotel maybe this could be an option.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: katrooney1
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here,yes the rooms are small, but they are clean, got excellent aircon/heating,bath/shower,tv etc. The location is ideal.10 minute walk to central park and for John Lennon fans the Dakota building.we took cabs everywhere so didn try the subway which is close-by.a cab to times sq is around $10 plus tip n that applies to empire state,Rockerfella building,ground zero etc.the staff wer friendly and there is computers to use downstairs and a telephone.apart from the small room i could not fault this hotel at all..... Which didn't matter anyway as there is so much to do and see we only went back there to sleep!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Quiet Neighbourhood Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Jim B
Reviews.Content: I really like this place. I have stayed at the Belnord twice. Just a block from the Subway #1 train on Broadway. Upper West Side, lovely brownstone street, tree lined, and CLEAN beautifully kept Victoria charm, with a modern cleanup. The rooms are spotless and smell clean. New lamenant flooring, New shower stalls and windows. Nice bedding a doored closet and television. I must warn you, this is the smallest room I have ever had, the bathroom small as well, but with a window. My room faced a courtyard and was So Quiet is was like I was living in the country. Trees out the window and birds singing how about that for NYC. Amsterdam Ave. on the end of the street, with the BEST DELI called "Barney Greengrass", I have since got to be familiar and a regular customer there while in NYC. I buy all the waiters socks in addition to their tips, ( they are on their feet all day) and they remember me. I love the neighbourhood. The hotel has a grand entrance all in white and gold and makes you feel very special. The dark wood and timeless antiques in the lobby are not haunting dingy and dusty, Everything shines. The elevator is smooth. There is a desk with lots of tour information and phamplets and great city maps. An attendant on duty 24-7. They are very secure and monitered. And helpful. I requested extra towels, and they were delivered right away, white, fluffy , new, and warm just out of a dryer, imagine that as well! I must say the Spanish maids were VERY noisey in the early mornings in the hallways. Yelling to each other while cleaning the rooms. I complained about that and they switched the attendant to Spanish men who were very professional and gracious. ( I think those guys understood what I meant :) I do tend to need a bigger space in the room, so I have moved on from the Belnord, but I was pleasantly surprised, and felt that I was staying in someones historical home, that they preserved and cared for in an updated and professional way. It again did not have the feeling of a flashback to a museum of dust and darkness, you can tell right away, this had been upgrading to the current times. I admired that. No food or beverage amedities, that is all in the surrounding neighbourhood streets. Trendy shops, eateries, Central Park within walking distance and Times Square 10 minutes on the subway. Very safe, a little gem.

Reviews.Title: “A few days in New York”
Reviews.Author: Phill E
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Belnord for 3 nights. Whilst the rooms are not huge,you get a bed and about a metre squared of floor space, but there is a cupboard to put luggage in, they are clean and the bed is comfortable. The bathroom was small, and the bath could not be used by an adult but the shower had lots of hot water at all times of the day. It was cleaned everyday with fresh towels put in. The free wi-fi works well, although I don't know why the code was changed every day. The location is only a few minutes from the subway and there is a 24 hour pharmacy/newsagent/supermarket thing at the end of the road. The walk to central park only took ten minutes. I would recommend the Belnord and I'm sure we will stay there again when we go back to NY.

Reviews.Title: “one serious reservation”
Reviews.Author: genemean
Reviews.Content: This hotel has had a really good restoration. Room price is great for New York. But, if you are claustrophobic it's not for you. The halls are very narrow and the room is very small. There was one full bed and nightstand with room at the bottom for the bed for your luggage. Bath was small but brand new with tile and fake marble. If you are just there to sleep and clean up it's a good choice. p.s. there's a great late night deli around the corner on Broadway.

Reviews.Title: “tastefully compact”
Reviews.Author: catlin24
Reviews.Content: As we checked the friendly desk clerk told us that all the room were small but small has a negative aspect and I think compact is a better term. If your planning a short active visit to the city and you want a room that is clean and doesn't coast more that you mortgage payment then the Belnord Hotel is a good choice. The bathroom was very clean with nice tiles and plush towels. There is enough room to move around the bed but don't plan on throwing a party.

Reviews.Title: “WoW How do they fit it all in”
Reviews.Author: S6Geezer
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews saying how small this place is and still went. They were right it is the proverbial broom cupboard. That said it does the job but they could put more shelving in or something. If you shop as much as we did, makes it very difficult to move. I dont thing the size is justified by the cost so pay a bit nmoire and get a normal size room unless you want a 'mini' adventure! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Typical NYC Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: HouseOfHearts
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to NYC and wanted to stay somewhere away from the big crowds. This was the perfect place, small rooms (about the same size room we paid $300 for last trip at a high end hotel instead of the Belnord's price of $100+). The staff was helpful and friendly. Since we are walkers everything seemed closed from there plus on Sunday that part of Broadway is shut down for a street market where I did most of my gift shopping for the year, at yummy vendor food and ran into some very nice locals. All in all I would recommend this hotel to anyone for the price and location it can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny but immaculate!”
Reviews.Author: Mikeney
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in NYC. This room was by far the smallest but also by far the cleanest. The floors are polished to a mirror finish. The bathroom was blindingly clean and well fitted for a single. Bedding is not the pinnacle of comfort but is functional and holds its own in a city of this "stature." NYC is notorious for ridiculous hotel prices and incongruous quality. Even if it isn't a bargain in sq ft, I feel it is worth it considering the extra effort put into upkeep and maintenance. I repeat the rooms are minuscule but considering the UWS location and price I would stay here again. It is worth repeating. As of October 2011 these rooms glisten compared to even some of the "4+ stars" I have stayed in. Check in was a breeze. Staff was cool but efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: GM796
Reviews.Content: The location is very good, the subway is a block away and you can walk to the nearby resturants. The rooms are clean but small. The price is very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Basic Hotel with Extremely Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: JakeAComo
Reviews.Content: The location is very good - one block from the red 123 line. The service is adequate but don't expect smiley, happy faces. Our room had one full size bed with enough room to walk around the bed (18-20 inches), two small bedside tables and that was it. A flat screen mounted on the wall with apparently only channels available off the air - no cable/satellite. Bathroom very small - maybe 6' x 5' and very small opposite closet. The room was clean enough. This is a place to sleep that is close to the subway - end of story.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculously small rooms, otherwise fine”
Reviews.Author: Mangustena
Reviews.Content: I can't say I had any bad feelings when I left this hotel. It was fine. The location one block away from the metro was very convenient. The neighborhood is safe and nice. The hotel is clean. Can't say about the noise, because I slept with earplugs. However, when I walked into the room for the first time, I burst out laughing at how small the room was. And I didn't even notice at first the narrow slits of the closet and the door to the private bathroom. I am uploading a picture of the bathroom for everyone to judge for themselves... There is no restaurant in the hotel, so no breakfast or anything like that.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, though a bit pricey for the size”
Reviews.Author: driedsoap
Reviews.Content: It was a clean hotel, with limited space but served its purpose well. Bathroom was small (door hit the toilet) but well maintained and seemed to have been newly renovated. The beds were comfortable and I slept well, though stepping directly into the room and hitting the bed was a bit of a let down as the photos seemed to represent a more comfortable space. I would probably opt to stay at a nearby hostel instead of paying the price tag of New York lodgings.

Reviews.Title: “Never again...”
Reviews.Author: Tired65
Reviews.Content: I'm sitting at the airport now, just after spending 5 nights at the Belnord, and I feel it is my duty to warn my fellow travellers! Pro's - Cheap (well, cheap compared to other hotels in Manhattan) - Located right near a subway station which made getting into the downtown area nice and easy - Clean - I guess when the rooms are this tiny there's not much to clean... Con's - The room size - I can't stress enough how hilariously small the rooms are! If you just pretend your on a boat in a small cabin, it makes it almost bearable. Possibly as small as 6.5ft by 8.5ft, these things are tiny. - The staff - I can't decide if they were apathetic, or surly, or just didn't like their job. The cleaners where chirpy enough though. - Noise! So much noise! Loud aircon, cleaning staff banging around early in the morning, phones constantly ringing in the corridors, neighbours having sex... this place had it all. - Facilities - The shower had a mind of its own and the internet was a pain to use and slowwwww during peak times. All in all, if I could do it again, I'd just go mega cheap and stay at a backpackers or something similar, or cough up an extra $50-$100 a night and stay in a better hotel. This place was not worth the middle ground. And then upon checkout I overhead that one of the guests had their bag turned inside out in the supposed 'secure' luggage room (to which the person at the front desk replied 'sorry, it happens sometimes').

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for an Overnight”
Reviews.Author: Lazier
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Belnord. I particpated in the New York City Triathlon this year and last year and needed a convenient location to access both the 79 Street Boat Launch, Riverside Park, and Central Park. This is a great neighborhood in the upper west side of Manhattan, NY. There are many restaurants, meuseums, etc within walking distance. We also want to have the room as reasonable as possible. Rooms can be very expensive in NY. $169 per night and just under $200 with taxes. Not bad at all for Manhattan. This place is clean, very clean ! Here is the only negative. The rooms are very small with double beds. The room measures about 8 x 8. Also has a flat screen TV and bathroom. But hey, when your in Manhattan, your not here to hang out in your room. This is a great place to sleep and wash up.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect budget hotel, no frills”
Reviews.Author: tink198922
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for two nights in mid July on a tight budget (we are both students). The hotel was excellent value and the location is great with a subway station just round the corner and is within walking distance of all the main attractions. It is definitely the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in as the bed takes up the majority of the room. If you don't plan to be in your room apart from sleeping then it's no problem at all. The room was very clean, service was fine and the shower and television worked perfectly. The free wifi was also very useful. Basic hotel at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Teeny, Tiny Room”
Reviews.Author: kmjimenez
Reviews.Content: The bath room was clean, the service was adequate,the air conditioning worked in the heat wave, location just what I wanted but the room was the smallest hotel room I've eve seen. When I called to ask if a roll away could be put in the room because my son decided to join me I was told that they "don't do rollaways". What they didn't tell is that the room is so small a roll away won't fit. Still laughing......

Reviews.Title: “Small, Clean, Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: LanaDecle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from July 18-21st. Tried not to have expectations, as it was our first time staying at a budget hotel. However, we were pleasantly surprised! The room was very clean, very modern, but super small! We are a couple in our lower 20s, so we spent little time in the room so the size did not matter. Hot water took a couple minutes to start up, but never failed once it started. Front desk employees were helpful, considerate, and pleasant. They have a luggage room and a shower/bathroom in the lobby to freshen up if your check in isn't for a while, or if you have already checked out. Keep in mind, this is a budget hotel so that means no fridge, no large closet, and a small tv. But who needs those things in NYC? The location is Upper West Side, a seconds walk from the main subway stations and bus lines. And SAFE. As safe as you can get in a major city. What more could you ask for? Would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, small but clean, we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: TeachNZ78
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had separate rooms on the first floor. The rooms were extremely clean. Yes, the room was small but suited our needs. A Starbucks is right around the corner and it is close to restaurants and in a quiet neighborhood. Parking is around the corner in a parking lot. Call to confirm if you are concerned about your reservation (we did as we were arriving very late in the evening) and we booked directly through the hotel on the internet. No problems. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: NancyIzak
Reviews.Content: the beds are so small that it is impossible for two adults to sleep. no hot water in the shower, it takes 5 minutes to heat and then after 20 seconds it goes back to freezing cold. 6 times i got calls on my room at different times of the day and night, asking if it was the front desk, the other passangers press the front desk button on the phone and it rang in my room. I told the front desk that I was expecting a visit from an old aunt and to please let me know as soon as she arrives, i had to call down and the lady was already 15 minutes waiting for me. when we arrive the pillow and shower has hairs from another person. In other words they dont care the passangers.

Reviews.Title: “For a budget hotel is perfect”
Reviews.Author: Mika042
Reviews.Content: I booked the accommodation two day earlier than the arrival and it was 109 dollars for a night. Really good price for the location (close to Central Park, subway, city center). The room is probably the smallest hotel room is New York, but it was clean and they cleaned the room every day. The staff were helpful and friendly. I can recommend this hotel, if you would like to spend a few nights (not a whole week) in New York, you only would like to use the hotel for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs and no understanding or cooperation”
Reviews.Author: mcook54956
Reviews.Content: I looked at the dots on my bed to see if any of them moved and one did. I pulled back the covers further, put a plastic cup over the bug and tried to call the desk from my room phone,but could not, because THAT is an extra charge. I walked down to front desk, asked for the Manager, Armando, and asked him to look at the bug. He did not want to and did not believe me, saying he would call a technician to look at. Later he said the technician found nothing in this room and that this room "typically" does not have bugs. Also they did not answer phones for 40 rings. I had Expedia verify the number and they did not answer for Expedia either. If you want to cancel your room, it must be done by 11:59, but they may not answer the phone, and then not let you out of a room change, charging for a full night, even if you can not stay. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, abysmal service”
Reviews.Author: W_Mitty_x
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the good thing first: the location. It's near a subway and alongside Broadway, and it takes about 20 minutes to get to Times Square from the moment you leave your room. Now for the bad things. (a) The rooms are TINY. I stayed in 3 separate rooms over 2 weeks (after taking trips to Chicago and Washington DC during my stay) and all are tiny; the rooms I had one double bed, one beside table and a few poles to hang your clothes on. (One had a tiny toilet instead.) The room is big enough to put the double bed with about 1.5 feet to spare on either side of the bed. (b) The counter staff are incompetent and very rude. They lost our reservation for the second leg of the trip and were patronising, unhelpful and contemptuous. They would claim that 'your reservation is not on the system' and repeatedly ask, "What website did you book it on?", and when we couldn't immediately remember they repeated themselves as though we were slow 3-year-olds. This is a service industry, but they don't recognise that or choose not to bother. (c) Interestingly, every 2 or 3 times we passed the counter in the lobby, we'd see a disgruntled customer discovering that his/ her deposit had been conveniently lost by the hotel. Word to the wise: document every single transaction you have with this hotel, or you're going to see your money magically disappear. (d) For the last 4 days of our stay in NYC, we stayed on the 4th floor, and the lift lobby on the 4th floor smelled as though someone had urinated in it, and the smell got progressively worse and had not been dealt with on the day we checked out. You know you have a problem if the NYC subway smells better than your lift lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, cant fault the place really.”
Reviews.Author: TEFLnick
Reviews.Content: My son and stayed here for 3 nights in May 2011. Was pleasantly surprised as was worried about the quality of a budget hotel in NYC. Location - On the corner of Broadway and 86th, probably a little too far to comfortably stroll downtown and back each day, but within perhaps 100 metres of a subway stop. Same sort of distance to local diners, and keep walking towards Times Square for a few minutes and you'll find a cinema if you want to catch a movie too. Twin rooms are not as small as suggested in other reviews based on our experience, and accomodation was far better than similar budget hotels in Paris, Prague and Italy. Comfortable beds, ample storage space, wall mounted TV and tidy bathroom. From the 5th floor I did hear road noise all night, but it wasnt too intrusive and the beds were so comfortable they compensated. Checking in and out was simple, and staff searched online to find me an address for a particular place I wanted to visit. Had one small problem in the bathroom and reception sent a guy to fix it within 30 minutes. I had originally booked another place, but read such terrible reviews here I changed to the Belnord and was a little concerned about room sizes etc. However, compared to budget hotels I have stayed in elsewhere, there was very little to fault here hence giving it a good rating.

Reviews.Title: “Remember this is New York...”
Reviews.Author: t0309999
Reviews.Content: The rooms are TINY here. So when you open the door you almost hit the bed LOL. But its good for 2 people if not staying too long. No space at all. But its good location. Quiet for being NY and clean. Internet also available

Reviews.Title: “Spotlessly clean, quiet,comfortable,ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: peterdavy50
Reviews.Content: The rooms may be small but all you do is sleep in them after all. It was operating theatre clean and secure. Quiet, fully equipped and the staff from reception to cleaners were friendly, helpful and unfailingly cheerful. Check in was simple and there are facilities for storing your luggage after check out until you depart for the airport. Situated between Central Park and Broadway, fabulous for ease of getting to attractions by walking, subway, bus or cab. There are also facilities for storing your own food (fridge and freezer), a microwave,oven and sink in a nice seating area. Can't recommend it highly enough, when next in New York we'll book in there without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “It's a good thing we didn't want to spend time in the room”
Reviews.Author: Dufustcherskovich
Reviews.Content: The room was so small, you had to go outside to change your mind! Seriously, it was small, with the least possible space to maneuver. And the closet was so small, with a shelf near the bottom, that I couldn't hang up my bag--which was all I'd brought. At least the small bed (double, too small for me and the wife) was not nearly firm enough. And if you're claustrophopic, look forward to that teeny-tiny bathroom. On the other hand, the dinky TV on the wall didn't work properly; not only were the colors all weird and dark, but, strangely, the pictures did not fit on the screen. This place was good for one thing: a roof over one's head to go sleepy-bye. It was quiet at night where we were. And not inexpensive. Staff were friendly; cooperative people at the front desk (tho we didn't ask for anything). Appalling, just appalling, that you have to PAY for coffee/tea in the lobby. You'd think that the economy had already tanked, big-time. It's just a darned good thing we didn't need to spend time in our room. Sheesh! The best thing about the place was the location--easy access to subway, eateries, Central Park. This is the kind of place you stay when you don't have $300 to plunk down per night, and there's nothing else available. It may well be that comparatively speaking, this hotel was okay, perhaps even good; but can't really say since haven't spent time in other low-end places. Outside of NY, though, this would be termed a total ripoff.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Xsarah_24
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying at this hotel while travelling around the USA. The price was excellent and the location could not be better. Yes the rooms are small but you do not spend much time in them at all when you are in this city. At least the rooms are quiet and comfortable, the views are not great but if you want to see the city then go outside and go up the Empire State. The staff were always around cleaning the rooms, saying goodmorning/ goodevening and the front desk were polite and organised, they were always happy to give you help with wifi connection etc. They even booked our return transfer back to the airport for us. There is no bar or restaurant on site but you only have to walk to the end of the block and you are surrounded by choice. Location is the best bit, in the morning we would walk to the cafe on the corner get breakfast, then go sit in Central Park. We were very lucky with weather and Central Park is beautiful. It was around $8 to get a taxi down to Times Square, $10 to Bloomingdales or the Empire State. I would definitely stay at this hotel again when visiting NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Don't say at the Benord Hotel, NYC - Under any circumstances”
Reviews.Author: MerrimackTraveler
Reviews.Content: Probably the worse hotel I've ever stay at in NYC. Not only were the rooms tiny - getting off the elevator and walking down the narrowest hallway leading to the rooms I've ever seen, I opened the room door only to immediately hit the bed. There wasn't 8 inches between the door leading out of the room and the bed. The other side of the bed hit the other wall - and the bed was a DOUBLE - not a queen or anything larger. The bathroom was tiny - don't try and sit down on the toilet and, at the same time, try and close the door. It's pretty difficult if not impossible. My advice: Don't stay at the Belnord Hotel if you have any other choice.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience I've ever had with a hotel, they are dishonest!”
Reviews.Author: Spring02
Reviews.Content: I had read the rooms were small, but I was in no way prepared for just how small they were. Our regular sized bed was up against the wall, the foot of the bed was about two feet from the wall and the other side of the bed was about three feet from a wall. We literally could not maneuver around the room to walk with our luggage in it. The bathroom was so small I was claustrophobic, you had to reach under the sink for the toilet paper! The walls were paper thin. After finding out I could not use my cell phone in my room, I knew we could not stay there the second night we had planned to. I stood out in the rain at night to make some necessary phone calls, including one to Expedia to tell them I would be checking out the next morning because I found the hotel unacceptable. They said fine, I would get my money back on the second night. I checked out early the next morning telling the front desk staff I was leaving, giving them my keys and looking over the charges from the previous night. When home and calling Expedia to get money back for the second night is when the real nightmare began. This hotel lied to Expedia, first by saying I didn't check out at all and then saying I checked out two hours late!! The hotel had no intention of giving back any money. After two days and a total of four hours on the phone, including my calling the hotel back three times myself, I was told by Expedia I wasn't getting any money returned because of what the hotel was saying. This is a totally dishonest hotel, for that reason alone I hope that people will not give them business. They blatantly lied!

Reviews.Title: “Smaller than a sardine can, horrible service, but ok value for new york city”
Reviews.Author: chimichanga8
Reviews.Content: The price and location is good considering it's in New York City, however, the room and bathroom were ridiculously small, barely any room for two suitcases, and one adult alone in the bathroom was very claustrophobic. Customer service was pretty horrible, they did not assist me with the beverage machine when it did not work, and they don't have a phone you can use to call for delivery, you have to go out a bit into the streets to use a pay phone. Overall if you're only staying for a couple nights, and need a place to just sleep and shower, than belnord hotel is doable. Otherwise, you need to pay more to stay in a larger hotel with better service in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good value - watch out for parking recommendations”
Reviews.Author: Minooka_Mary
Reviews.Content: Place was clean, very very nice for the price -updated - would stay there again - no bed bugs. We were very comfortable- however beware of PARKING recommendations - this incident reported by another traveler was EXACTLY what happened to us - "...must use the public parking garage one block away. The hotel clerk claimed we would get 25% off of the $40 parking rate in fact we only got $5 off. The parking attendant pretends to not underrstand english whenever we asked about our entire $10 discount." Cheaper garages are closer - do NOT go with hotel parking recommendation - something FISHY going on. A little noisy at times but the rooms were so nice - if it weren't for the parking incident I would hardily recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny and noisy”
Reviews.Author: ttorneby
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at the Belnord hotel when I was visiting NYC in April 2011. The rooms including bathroom was clean, but extremely small and noisy. There was no room for a suitcase, and the bathroom was so small that when seated at the toilet it would have been possible to drink water from the tap. Not suitable for large people. The walls must have been made from cardboard or something similar, because there is absolutely no sound insulation between the room and the hallway/neighbour rooms. In addition the ventilation was extremely noisy, which altogether kept me awake during night. The staff at the reception wasn´t unfriendly, but they seemed rather uninterested. The housekeepers were noisy and increased the noise problem.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: ontheroad12419
Reviews.Content: if you need a lot of space try the holiday inn,,,,if you want a great deal in nyc stay here....small rooms , I only sleep there, great location, quiet, clean and cheap for nyc with tax $140 ish.......

Reviews.Title: “Staff and management lacks customer service”
Reviews.Author: Hofung_D
Reviews.Content: The manager and front desk staff lacks customer service, my car got tolled because of them, when we asked for more pillows it seems like we were asking for gold. they don't even look at you when you ask a questions, it seems like you are begging them when you are paying for their service. I will never stay at this place ever again!!!

Reviews.Title: “A fine place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mom-and-Teen
Reviews.Content: I do enjoy this hotel -- have stayed there several times and have been overall quite pleased each time. The location is superb, just off a main boulevard on the upper west side, quite convenient to the subway. Seems a very safe neighborhood. There are several shops and grocery stores nearby. The rooms are indeed tiny. I am a smallish person, and were I bigger I might not have been so comfortable, esp. if travelling with someone also large. The cleanliness is tops, however, and the bed quite comfortable. Oddly, I found some of the front desk staff to be rather unfriendly (esp. the night shift), which stuck out because everyone else was so pleasant. I will not be staying here on an upcoming trip because I found someplace a good bit cheaper, but I will miss the Belnord. Maybe next time!

Reviews.Title: “Very poor customer service and dishonest”
Reviews.Author: ruchel
Reviews.Content: I booked a room through travelocity for January 26th at the Belnord Hotel. However, my flight into NYC was cancelled because JFK was closed due to a snowstorm. I could not get into NYC on any other flights, neither bus nor train (Amtrak). I called travelocity and explained I had to cancel my reservation even though it was less than 24 hours notice and I asked if I could get a refund. I was told that I would have to send an e-mail to the manager of the Belnord hotel with this request. I e-mailed the manager at the address I was given right away, got no response, and then tried e-mailing again a few days later but still got no response. I've put in multiple calls to the hotel but I'm always told that it's only the manager who can deal with these types of issues (ie deciding whether or not a refund might be in order) but even when I've called between 9am-4pm, the manager is never available and the front desk gives various excuses such as that she's already gone for the day, that she's sick or that her whereabouts are generally unknown. I had planned on staying at the Belnord when I reschedule my trip to NYC but now I've decided to find a different hotel that at least addresses cutsomer concerns/requests instead of ignoring them completely. If the manager had at least e-mailed or called and said that it was not possible to give me a refund, I would be much more satisfied. Instead, I have gotten no response at all! This behavior is simply rude and unfriendly and seems quite dishonest as well. This has been a very disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great price/location, small room”
Reviews.Author: Whitleywalker
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed 4 nights at the Belnord on our 6th trip to the City. Fantastic location! But be forewarned that folks aren't kidding when they say the rooms are SMALL. It was okay with me, I'm 5'8" 150 lbs. Husband is 5'10" 200 lbs and he felt the room was too small for him. Bathroom nicely sized. We always found the room and the hotel to be clean. NO bedbugs ~ whew! The price was why we tried the Belnord - best price for accommodations we could find.

Reviews.Title: “Belnord Detractors”
Reviews.Author: DreamStuffer
Reviews.Content: Checked into hotel on evening of November 17. Hotel staff was courteous and efficient. Room was immaculate. Hallways could use some sound abatement. Rolling wheels on wood make quite a rattling sound at 3:00AM. Bath tubs are extremely slippery and without grab rails, a lawsuit waiting to happen. Do not ask front desk personnel to arrange for transportation to local airports! I was charged $50.00 to be taken from the hotel to LaGuardia. It only cost me $32.00 to travel from LaGuardia to the hotel. Demand a standard New York taxi and accept nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “great value, clean, excellent base”
Reviews.Author: J_Leics
Reviews.Content: Great base for trip to New York, very close to subway. Perfect for morning runs in Central Park. Plenty of restaurants around for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Stayed in room with bathroom on an excellent rate. Friendly staff. Hotel was spotlessly clean throughout. Expected room to be smaller having read other reviews, but had a standard double bed (a bit bouncy, but comfortable enough), wardrobe, mirror, TV, ensuite with shower, loads of hot water. No tea / coffee facilities, but plenty of options outside hotel. Luggage store (free) was handy for late flight. The only negative we could find was the noisy air conditioning units, which disturbed us at night (from the room below). Would recommend friends and family to stay here, but bring ear-plugs!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: shanamp
Reviews.Content: Room is small, no like small. Take one step in the room you are at the bed, four steps from door you are at the wall, to open suitcase you had to put it on the bed. Private bathroom, not so clean, the shower water would jump from warm to superhot (had to jump out the shower and almost break my neck twice), TV had about 20 channels of which 15 of them where spanish, tbs, home shopping network, a local cable show, and the news. NO ESPN!!!! Unless you plan on spending every waking moment outside of your room with no downtime in between, this is not the place. Too expensive, spend the additonal $50-$100 and stay @ the Marriott. 3 nights $472--never again, almost ruined my first trip to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Andy255093
Reviews.Content: Quite pricey, but all New York hotels are. Room was a bit small, but absolutely spotless, modern and everything needed for our stay. When looking for a hotel in NY we wanted somewhere safe, clean and not far from all the sights. The Belnord did not disappoint!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect for the explorer”
Reviews.Author: angelawilson810
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for luxury and room service you shouldn't be looking into a hotel in the price range. However, if you are a true traveler and are in NY to experience city life and all the sights you probably will enjoy staying here. It is clean, relatively comfortable and perfect suitable for a place to sleep. Small, but where isn't in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: paudbrowne
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights for the New York Marathon. The hotel is located in a nice quite area of city on the upper west side 3 blocks from Central Park. Subway station 1 block away.The reception staff were not very friendly no "good morning" or "have a nice day" even. Some of them their English was not great! The hotel is clean,quite and the bed was comfortable. The room size maybe a problem, my room was small but as I was staying on my own it was ok. If two people were staying it would be very tight for space. There are no tea or coffee makeing facilities. Coffee machine behind reception. Value for money? Well it cost me 1000 Euro for 6 nights so make your own mind up. For me it was the best value I could find in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room...TV hell”
Reviews.Author: SeaWBryant
Reviews.Content: The TV system is ridiculous...cannot even get WNBC 4 yet there are 10 spanish language stations. The front desk clerk acted like 'what's wrong with that'...the rate reflects the room size and shouldn't come with an essentially non-working TV. Kudos to Carlos who came up and tried to fix it...but his version of 'fixed' is the choce of channels and fuzziness you get.

Reviews.Title: “sad to report bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: SophSoph04
Reviews.Content: My husband is very allergic to bb's, so we are quite vigilant when researching hotels and checking out rooms before putting down our luggage. Sadly, we we missed something and he woke up after several hours with nearly 40 large welts. The staff was great and moved us for the night (we are sure there were no bugs in the new room) and then reimbursed us. I just discovered that there are multiple reports for bedbugs under the name "Belnord Residence Hotel", dating from this month back to 2007. Wish I had seen them. The hotel was spotless and in a fabulous location. We think the bugs were in the curtains or behind the headboard. We have so much experience looking for signs we can't believe we missed something. Really unfortunate about the BB's

Reviews.Title: “Really small rooms”
Reviews.Author: deshanko
Reviews.Content: The place was clean, but I was shocked when I opened the door and saw how small the room was. The bed was small and it crunched when you sat on it, it sounded like it was full of hay. If I didn't pay so much for it, it would have been a good value. I couldn't find a hotel in the city for the Saturday night I was there, so I took what I could get. If I paid $150 for it, I could have dealt with it, but I paid $260.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable, quiet hotel, close to subway and Central Park”
Reviews.Author: donhal07
Reviews.Content: Stated here for one night after visiting New York on business. Great location, near to subway station and Central Park. Checked in immediately, friendly staff. Rooms clean and tidy, but very small, wasn't bothered by that though as we only wanted it to sleep in and the beds are comfortable. Rest of the time was doing the usual sightseeing so £130 for 1 night is steep but you won't get much cheaper in NYC unless you want to stay in a hostel or the Bronx! Lots of lovely restaurants along Columbus Avenue worth walking down in the evening. Safe luggage room for our last day as we didn't fly home until late evening. Definitely recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good, cheap place”
Reviews.Author: EdwardSanFranciscoq
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Belnord the last week in August. For the upper west side and the price, this is a good deal. Yes, the rooms were very small, but SPOTLESS. The internet kept going out, but it seems from the reviews that this was common just that week, they had some kind of router problem. And, since I do IT for a living, I can understand that. Also, it was HOT in New York that week, and the air conditioning was great. I could set my own controls for the AC, and it blasted cold air, which was a relief. Had large screen TV with mucho channels. The staff was very nice when I checked in, and was very nice when I checked out and told me how to get to the airport. Like all of NY, even though this is a great hood, it is a little sketchy very early in the morn if you go outside. I'm an 5 to 6 am riser, and went over to the bagel shop that early on Broadway, can't remember the name but it is across the street from the Starbucks on Broadway and very good, and there were some suspicious characters hanging around, which didn't bother me b/c I live in the Tenderloin in SF, but to the unassuming traveler that expects a nice neighorhood to be safe at all times, I'd be a little careful, but that is NY. Great access to restaurants, Broadway, and I think it is Amsterdam on the other side, have every imaginable type of food, and there are laundromats around too. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, new, nice neiborhood, affordable - works for me!”
Reviews.Author: Lina_Brasil
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms are small and the reception is not very friendly but my main concern is cleaness because I am very allergic (asma and sinusitis). This hotel was recently renovated, has new hardwood floors in the rooms and hallways (this is good because I hate hotels with smelly old carpets!). And is very clean! No mold or smoke smell, no old curtains. The rooms are very clean, didn´t see any mouse or rat trap. Shower with hot and strong water, air conditioning works well and didn't find it noisy. The double bed is small, then choose a room with two beds if you need more space. The location is not central, but it is a nice family neighborhood and very quiet, with excellent shops and restaurants nearby - recommend Ollies (Chinese fast food), Good Enough to Eat and Sarabeth's (these two for breakfast), Carmine's (large portions Italian dinner). The subway station is very close (line 1). Try to ask for room 303 because it is a little bigger, has a small hallway at the entrance, a small closet, desk and chair. The view is not that great, but it is very quiet. I would stay in this hotel again because it is clean and despite the high price it is still cheaper than other hotels... We paid $ 240 (with taxes) for double room in September 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Compact but cute!”
Reviews.Author: Hannzie
Reviews.Content: As someone who tends to go the cheapest hotel/hostel I can find, often ending up with some absolute dives, I was pleasantly surprised with one of the cheapest rooms in NYC! I'm quite used to sharing bathroom facilities, so having our own bathroom was a bonus in itself. Yes, admittedly the rooms are small, but ultimately, who needs space to walk around in anyway? Perhaps if you are planning on spending a bit of time in the room reading etc, you may feel like you require something bigger, but as a simple base, Belnord hits all the right spots. We had a cleaning service every day that we were there (4 nights) and found it to be most satisfactory, and we definitely had no qualms about leaving valuables in the room. Location of the hotel is good, a 2minute walk to the nearest subway, which takes you to Times Square in about 10 mins. Central park is a couple of blocks away, lovely to walk through in the morning! Also, on Sundays a couple of blocks away (76th between Columbus and Amsterdam) there was an incredible flea market which I highly recommend! I've seen a few people comment on the reception staff, have to say i had no problems with them, although we didn't make any enquiries, so perhaps this is why! To sum up, i would most definitely stay here again, and recommend it to friends, feel free to ask any questions!

Reviews.Title: “A CUTE PLACE FOR HOBBITS! LITERALLY THE SMALLEST ROOMS IN THE WORLD!!”
Reviews.Author: Markiemoscow
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Manhattan are an absolute rip off and what to do but to stay in a clean BOX (for hobbits) for the night in a quiet and safe spot Uptown! Reception do warn you that the rooms will be small to avoid you complaining! And yes, you're not disappointed when you find your room door scrapes your comfy double bed when literally fills the room. Hmm, where to put my bags, in the shower tray doubling as a Japanese bath tub? And be careful not to roll out of bed and in to the toilet! The flatscreen tv on the wall is great, except you can knock it off the wall as you walk round the bed! However, you'll sleep well here and you'll even get 'free' wireless internet if you ask for an access code every 24 hours. Unfortunately guys, this is the best you'll get for the money in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Small room”
Reviews.Author: bannok23
Reviews.Content: Room sure is small. The best thing about this hotel is private bath. Wifi did not work at all during my two nights stay. Also, the hallway is very narrow. Room is clean. The hotel is about two blocks from subway, two blocks from central park.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but BE WARNED: THERE ARE MICE IN THE ROOMS.”
Reviews.Author: higoomgala
Reviews.Content: Pros: very clean, and modern. Cons: 1) There are mice in the rooms! If you like mice, no problem. I was woken up by squeaking on one night, and the unmistakeable pitter patter of mice (we get mice occ in our house, so I know what I'm hearing!) I told the staff.....they said "there are no mice in our hotel". Interestingly, I found a mousetrap under the nightstand, which I was told that all rooms have as a precaution. 2) small room 3) Staff were the rudest I have ever seen...and I've stayed in quite a number of hotels. Price however, not bad for a NYC hotel, which is located off Broadway. But as the old saying goes "you get what you pay for".

Reviews.Title: “Feel tricked and mistreated”
Reviews.Author: fabbff
Reviews.Content: Billed for more than agreed upon. Rude staff. Very small room and bathroom. No tea /coffee. Stairs to climb. No view. Clustrophobic. Stripped bathroom toiletries. No one to talk to to discuss billing.

Reviews.Title: “Great for NY”
Reviews.Author: Delicieuse
Reviews.Content: For the NY standards the hotel is great, excellent position close to subway or bus going downtown, many shops and restaurants in the neighbourhood (Starbucks, Gap, Dunkin' Donuts, CVS... and the lively Amsterdam Avenue filled with all kinds of restaurants...). Also close to Central Park and Museum of National History (walking distance). The room was very small but very clean and renovated. For the time spent at the hotel it was more than fine. Free wi-fi is a real bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Belnord -double way too small for 2 people”
Reviews.Author: azarlucc
Reviews.Content: First of all the hotel had about 5 steps to climb up to lugging luggage, staff friendly and internet access good, but the room was entirely too small even for an overnight stay. I called down to the desk after we opened the door saying it must be a single room, not the double I booked and the receptionist insisted it was a double. No room for two pieces of luggage and the walls are too thin. We had stayed at the Days Inn on 94th and B-way, and although it was not renovated, the room was big, bed very comfortable and the bathroom was great, and we paid 120 instead of 128 for this one. I would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “good for the price”
Reviews.Author: caritomdq
Reviews.Content: overall is a good choice, rooms are small specially if u r shopping a lot :) walking distance from line 1 and steps from broadway. would go again....

Reviews.Title: “Best place for a couple on the Upper West Side”
Reviews.Author: pmbing51
Reviews.Content: Stayed here mostly because our son and daughter in law live on the next street over and their appartment is too small to comfortably accomodate all of us. The Belnord was recently renovated and a fine job they did. Everything was fresh and very clean. First let me make it clear that this is a boutique hotel in a pre war structure so the rooms are small and I wouldn't recommend it for a family. That being said it was just right for my wife and I. If you travel with a lot of luggage - there isn't a whole lot of space for it in the room. Staff and housekeeping were friendly and eager to help us find our way in the city. We arrived prior to check in time but were able to store our luggage and go have lunch at Shake Shack our favorite burger place in the city. The hotel is centrally located in a nice neighborhood, only 3 blocks west of Central Park and the subway, with many fine eateries. (Good Enough to Eat - recommend for breakfast, Bagel Basket, and Arties Deli to name just a few). Price wise it's a little pricey but within NYC limits.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: heidu83
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel and the location is excellent! I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great room for the price”
Reviews.Author: jrhsjh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just completed a 4 day trip to New York, which included 3 nights at the Belnord. I will start by saying I would stay here again without thinking about it. The hotel was very clean, was in a very safe and quiet part of town and had easy access to the subway (1 block away from the 1 train - 3.5 from B&D I think). We were 2.5 blocks from Central Park which was very nice. There is also plenty of restaurants and shopping close by. The staff was nice the whole time and we did need their help a couple times. The internet access was fast and easy to connect to. The only bad thing I could find is that rooms were small, very small, and an earlier comparison to a cruise ship was fairly accurate. There was a bed, two night stands, a little table and chair, a closet and a bathroom. The closet was nice sized for a travel closet, held all of our clothes fine. The bathroom was also very small, but had a tub, toilet and sink, so what else do you need?

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: JoanP60615
Reviews.Content: The room was probably too small to swing a cat, as they say, but I didn't bring my cats, so it didn't matter. Honestly, unless you're paying a fortune, you're going to get a small room in any New York hotel! Bottom line: clean room, friendly staff, down the block from a subway station, one block from a cross-town bus, lots of restaurants in the area. That's all you need. My only complaint would be that the bathtub is small.

Reviews.Title: “Good place...but a few issues....”
Reviews.Author: BartandLinda
Reviews.Content: A friend and I decided to check out some music at a restaurant near 88th and Columbus so we thought staying at the Belnord would be convenient....an easy walk back to the hotel at the end of the evening...which it was. But after reading all the complaints about the small rooms, I decided to go ahead and get the 'suite' that has two beds rather than the regular room. This worked out pretty well. Our room, 103, was on the first floor. It was long and skinny, but there was enough room. And it was clean. The bathroom door does hit the sink, but no big deal. One complaint would be the ice maker....it was right outside the room and was pretty noisy when it was being used....at 4 in the morning.... The complaints about the staff may be true depending upon your demands.....they are not really an outgoing bunch. But that being said, they were reasonably attentive to us when we asked questions and when we wanted to store our luggage for some time after checkout. They have a locked room downstairs for storing luggage...and that worked out well So the suite cost about an extra 50 bucks or so, but it was worth it. Total for the room with tax was $226. If I had a business or a pleasure to this area of NYC again, I would consider staying here (...but not too close to the ice maker).

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price, but not impressed”
Reviews.Author: NicolasChoukroun
Reviews.Content: I've been driving to New York in March 2010. I didn't booked any hotels so I had to book the same day from Internet. You can't book the Belnord by phone. The staff is friendly and it is easy to park your car in front of the hotel (but you have to remove it at 10am or it will be towed, at 12, you can park again). I had tested 2 rooms, a large one for $240/ night. This one was awful, located at the first floor, it was close to the Ice making machine and the permanent noise was so loud that it was very hard to sleep. Also the smell was disgusting, apparently someone smoked and they compensated with a lot of refresher, the mix was disgusting. The AC was not working and we had a very warm week just after a very cold winter. I was driving from Florida and the mix of smell, the hi-price and the AC would have deserved a 0 * in all count. Hopefully I changed the room to a less expensive one ($120/night) for the next 7 days. This second room was facing the back alley with dark buildings just in front of you. The room was so small that you had to jump over the bed to go from one side to the other side. It was very clean, and the bathroom was nice, I took baths and the water, soap and towel were all spotless. The AC was not work either, so I suspect that the temperature is mainly controlled form the hotel generator, and because the weather was exceptionally warm, the AC was heating whatever setting you were trying. They gently proposed to move again to another room but I stayed. Noise : the hotel is tiny, so are the corridors, the rooms and the walls, if you happen to have noisy people in the adjacent room, you feel like if you are in their room. One night I got a dunk couple who had an argument, I had to wait until they stopped to be able to sleep. Internet : they have a good Wifi, they change the password every night, it is free. Location : Excellent location, close to shops, 10 min walk from Center Park, 5 min from metro, it is the perfect spot for visiting NY. Conclusion: mixed feeling about the hotel, but for $120 / night I would go back. It is hard to find anything at less than $200 in The City!

Reviews.Title: “A great value on the Upper West Side - as long as you don't mind the world's smallest rooms!”
Reviews.Author: speedgraphic
Reviews.Content: We were allowed to check in almost four hours early - which was a godsend, because we didn't want to lug our luggage around all day. The hotel looked clean and recently renovated (which is apparently the case) and there most certainly IS an elevator now. Our room was spotless and decently appointed with modern decor... but WOW, was it small! This was the third budget hotel I've stayed in in NYC, and this room was an order of magnitude smaller than the next smallest room. It was about the size of an interior bunk-bed cabin in an old cruise ship. I could hardly use the toilet as my knees bumped into the sink in the bathroom! Still, it was quiet and provided a great jumping off point for a jazz club (Smoke) and the American Museum of Natural History. I can't complain... but make sure you can stand the small rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, shame about the reception staff!”
Reviews.Author: misskutiekat
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in excellent location! there is a subway station that gets you to all the main attractions less than a minute away!. The room was extremely clean which is really important to me as i have a dust allergie and i had no problems at all, the laminate floors helped a lot too. The room was very small but all you need for a place to rest your head and hand your clothes although i would take some extra hangers if you are going for more than a few days. The decor was nice and simple and I must say the bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds i have ever slept in! I think it was new. So great for a buget hotel. But my main gripe was the staff on reception, most of them where fine but one in particular was extremely rude and even turned round and told us too "phone yourself" when i asked her to call an excursion company about booking a tour! we tried but had no luck and had to work out the pay phone, eventually another guy came on reception and we asked him and he was fine. So expect to fend for your self and have to ask a few times at the least if you want any help! Also the air conditioning was rather noisy even when off so if your a light sleeper i'd take some ear plugs. Apart from my last 2 comments i would recommend this hotel if you want to do New York on a budget. Also for any vegan/veggie travellers there was an absolutely gorgeous vegan restaurant only 5 min walk away called the Peace Cafe great value and delicious lattes and desserts. Otherwise hot and crusties it just 5 mins and does amazing pizza.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for what it is !”
Reviews.Author: egoer
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean, nice , quiet , safe place in a very good neighborhood to put your head down and sleep, this place is perfect. The rooms are very clean and nice and so is the hotel. But the rooms are tiny. Main room is about 7 X 11 and the bathroom is very small. Excellent location, subway one block away. If you need a cheap place to sleep for a couple of nights, this is perfect. If you plan on spending any time in the room and need amenities and room to roam, this isnt the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: lookup
Reviews.Content: Maybe for others, the thing you take away from a stay here is new knowledge of how tiny bathroom sinks can be. For me, it's appreciation of the phrase, "location, location, location". A block to subway, ATM, market, drugstore, several decent cafes. We took a 5 minute walk to a lovely park along the Hudson, watching nannies with their strollers and little ones enjoy a Spring morning. The Hotel Belnord staff is helpful. The room is clean but tight. The price is right. TV is just the basics. Get out of the room and enjoy a great city. Isn't that the idea?

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: ahwatukeebrit
Reviews.Content: Like another reviewer I also booked on Expedia but had completely the opposite experience. The room was quiet (at the end of a corridor) and clean, the bathroom modern and spotless, the bed comfortable. Yes, all of these were small but as we were out all day sight seeing and only returned to shower and sleep, it was perfect for what we needed and half the price of more spacious hotels, with the bonus of free wifi for which many hotels make an outrageous charge. A couple of minutes to the subway station at Broadway & 86th, a couple of minutes in any direction to dozens of good cafes and restaurants on Broadway, Amsterdam and Columbus and only 10 minutes stroll to Central Park. My only quibbles were the lumpy pillows and the fact that returning one afternoon, we had no towels and had to wait 30 minutes for clean ones to be brought to the room. This was a good value base, in an excellent location, for a short sight seeing or shopping trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: atuckbyash
Reviews.Content: Got stuck in NY with the ash cloud and this was recommended on Expedia. Fortunately for us they only had 1 night available because it was an awful hotel. The staff couldn't be bothered to speak to you, the room was so small it was shocking and the bathroom was just about big enough to get into. Dinghy and dark room with no coffee/tea facilities and no room to move. Yes it was quite reasonable but I would not stay there again. The only positive was that it was a nice neighbour hood, although you did have to walk quite a distance to get to anywhere which we didn't mind. Sorry, but could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “So worth it, will stay there again!!”
Reviews.Author: DCtravelgrl
Reviews.Content: I don't understand the negative reviews. Yes, the rooms are small, but what did you expect? A regular NYC luxury room for $100.00? Come on now, lol. You get what you pay for. Look, for the money, the room was perfect. Everything was clean and new. Tiles, floor, entire bathroom. The funky winding hallway was interesting too!! The only two things I'd have to put a negative on was the bed and the lighting in the bathroom. The bed and pillows were standard issue .....the Westin it ain't. The lights reflected off of the bathroom mirrow, so it was hard to apply makeup or do our hair, but I found if I used my hand mirror with my back to the lights it worked out well............But the room suited its purpose, and that was to have a place to sleep at when we got in at 1am and a place to shower at 9 in the morning and leave. "Why would i pay upwards of $200.00 for a bigger room for less than a day's use? I wouldnt' make it a weeks stay, too small for that, but for a short term visit, it does the job The staff was wonderful and friendly, and the location???? I couldn't have asked for a better area.....#1 Subway line right around the corner, Central Park three blocks away, Great places to eat including a wonderfully low priced diner, beautiful architecture to gaze at on a leisurly walk. Wonderful. I recommended it to everyone I came in contact with. When we see Lady Gaga in July, or any other shor trip to NY, The Belnord is where we will be staying

Reviews.Title: “Horrible! Horrible! Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousLA87
Reviews.Content: The rooms are VERY small. Literally it takes one step from the door to the bed and one step from the bed to the bathroom. Housekeeping are thieves they stole $40 from my room. I had to call the police and file a report. The staff are RUDE and not helpful at all. Cable includes basic channels, the airplane I flew on had better channels than they did. Do not stay here! Yes the rooms are affordable if on a budget but not worth ALL the trouble you go thru while staying here. I would pay more money for a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Belnord Hotel is a fraud and sleezy”
Reviews.Author: collegemombaltimore
Reviews.Content: I booked on line at Expedia (which was a mistake because they lack a competent customer service department). When I opened the door to the room I couldn't fit my suitcase inside. The lumpy, dirty, double sized bed took up the entire room. There was about two feet around the bed. The bathroom shower stall did not have a shower curtain. There was a flat screen TV on the wall. There was no closet or anywhere to hang a coat. I saw the room and returned the key to the desk saying that what I booked on line was not what was in that room. They said no problem just call Expedia. I called Expedia and they said to call back during the week when the hotel manager was there. I called back to Expedia durign the week and spent over an hour on the phone explaining the situation. They called the hotel which said that I did stay there. Expedia had notes in their computer log that I called them right after I left the hotel. However, Expedia will not back me up and the Belnord will not refund my money. The staff at the Belnord also lied to Expedia about the name of the hotel manager. Don't stay here!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Overpriced and Extremely Uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: kingovny
Reviews.Content: Room was extremely overpriced, bed was very uncomfortable.pillows were bad also.. they only have full size beds.. no cable..just basic channels. rooms should go for 60 to 70 dollars at max with no exception.. you can hear just about everything the person in the next room is doing or saying. People at front desk are no help. No late check outs... don't get fooled if they tell you that you have the biggest room. the space is not necessary . DO NOT BOOK you can do better in a Motel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location for the money if you can stand small spaces!”
Reviews.Author: LLCoolDay
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my first trip to NYC...we stayed at the Belnord and it was excellent. If you are looking for a simple, clean hotel to shower & sleep, you can't go wrong staying here. And, it's in a great location a block from the subway station which takes you to Times Square in 10 mins or less. The only caution I have is the size of the rooms. Not for the claustrophobic :) The room we stayed in was about 8' x 10', plus a bathroom, so you don't want to spend too much time there. But it was clean, and tidy, and had all the basics.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest”
Reviews.Author: mj1337
Reviews.Content: The rooms are TINY. That picture you see of the Double Bed room is literally ALL there is to the room. You basically have room to walk from the door to the bed. The bathtub, and even sink are minature (didnt know they made sinks this tiny). The staff were VERY rude and unfriendly. And most importantly, if you're planning to do some sightseeing and shopping in Manhattan, the location is very inconvienient for getting around/dipping in to your hotel for a rest or to drop things off between outings. All in all, the price was excellant so if you really do just want a place to sleep and you dont mind being farher away from attractions, its worth the price and they have free wireless in all rooms. Bbut if I had to do it again I'd pay the extra $50 to stay at a nicer place though.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, ideal if only require somewhere to change and sleep”
Reviews.Author: grdnblak
Reviews.Content: Friendly service from staff when required, non-interfering and always someone at reception. Room was small and basic but clean. Room was cleaned as well as receiving fresh towels and new soap everyday. Only thing the roomed lacked was a mirror in the bedroom/living area as only mirror was in bathroom which was a slight inconvenience. Room could have perhaps done with a little more storage space as well. Located on the upper west side of Mahattan close to Central Park and the Hudson River. Area was quiet and has the 86th subway station round the corner which was ideal for travelling around as the line included stops for Times Square, Penn Station (Madison Square Gardens) and Liberty Island. All major attractions/sites (i.e. 5th Avenue, Empire State Building, Rockefeller Building) were within walking distance of a station on the line. Natural History Museum, Central Park and the Guggenheim Museum are all within walking distance of the hotel. If really eager, most popular sites can be walked to relatively easily (at a general pace, Times Square can be reached within an hour, this includes stopping and looking at everything on the way there!). There are a number of pleasant/recommendable local restaurants/bakeries that offer breakfast, lunch and dinner if you don't want to go far from the hotel for something to eat. There is also a multiscreen cinema a few blocks away if you fancy a quiet night!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EQ80
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, rooms are super clean and not tiny as I thought it would be. We had double room with private bath and it was perfect. Rooms were clean, linens fresh and great location. We got a great deal on their website and paid about US$75 a night which is incredible for a hotel in New York City!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Small room - good value for money”
Reviews.Author: hviswanathan
Reviews.Content: Room is tiny really really small but very clean and fantastic location. Just 1 minute from Subway (number 1) going to Times Square and statue of liberty. The rooms are very clean but bed is not great. Overall fantastic location and value for money. Close to NY restaurants. If you need good service and nice big room with bathrooms, then this is not ideal but for if you are more interested in seeing NY and will be out a lot, then highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lonetraveler73
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel just to keep your things, sleep, shower, and be in a safe location this is the hotel for you. Not much on amenities. It's in a great location 3 blocks from Central Park. Close to the Broadway and 86th subway. Perfect for a traveler. The rooms are tiny but clean. The hotel is on a quiet street. I did not hear other guests too much.

Reviews.Title: “The worst customer service”
Reviews.Author: almalone1
Reviews.Content: You need to retrain your entire front desk staff. I dealt with three separate individuals all poorer than the next. The first clerk couldn't even tell me where hotel guests can park their cars. She had no clue.The second clerk: I asked if there was a soda vending machine in the hotel he totally ignoed me. I will have to look on every floor until I find it. Doesn't know what floor it's on but it's in a corner.
