The third clerk: spoke very or limited English makes no sense.What the hell is going on with this hotel?" - If you do decide to stay at this hotel, be prepared for the following: - rude and disguisting service by the front-desk- French accent/Indian accent - elevator always had blankets and garbage from housekeeping on it. - no in-room safes - thin walls (you can hear your neighbours wake-up calls) - dirty and dated hallways - small bathrooms - limited services - 30 minute walk to Columbia (or 2 stops on the subway) In the future, I would look into staying elsewhere, possibly at a hotel chain. At least they have standards on room cleanliness and how to treat their guests.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION, SUPER CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: Travel4Fun010
Reviews.Content: We were a bit worried at what awaited us when we booked for less than $100/night with tax in the Tony West Central Park area, but boy were we thrilled when we checked in. The room was small, but was beautiful and newly remodeled. We opted for a private bath which was finished in marble with ample space to get ready every morning. Small closets made the limited space for storage in the room a distant concern. What was most wonderful was the maid service. EACH DAY we had new sheets, EACH DAY! The room was spotless, and had a soft floral scent each time we came back to it. Fresh towels and toiletries came with each turn of our room, and the front desk staff was knowledgeable about the area and gave great tips and directions. Overall, I don't think I could find the words to describe how impressed I was with this hotel. Such a value!

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly packaged.”
Reviews.Author: Deadlybiscuits
Reviews.Content: My girlfreind an I were in NYC for new year and stated in a hostel, for 4 nights, 10blocks up from here that was fairly poor even for th price we paid at that time of the year. But to our joy when we moved down to the belnord, for 3 nights the class difference was aparent, even if that hotel is the low end of the empire hotel group. However we knew the rooms would be small but there was everything there that was needed, even if it was almost shrunk to fit the smaller room dimensions. I stayed on the ground floor and it was a bit noisy from other guests but just lived with it. Room was pretty warm all the time even after turning off the heater an it was -10oc while we were there. Great location for the bus m104 straight to times square, subway around the corner and some great eateries within 2 mins walk. (city diner 91st & broadway, Tals bagels 86th& b'way, French roast 85th& b'way) to name a few! Thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would recomend to anyone who is realistic with their valuation of a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aaawilson08
Reviews.Content: Such a great place! We are going back again next month and hopefully more times int he future. I really recommend this place

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: rhoekenga
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went for my birthday in October. In short the hotel rooms are small, but it is NY and we had room for bags on the floor and to get to the bathroom. The bathroom was very clean and had full tub with shower head, nice newly redone. The rooms also had hard wod floor not carpet so it was easy to tell it was clean. Over all this place will give you your own bathroom and a nice clean bed to sleep in, and in a great location with a subway station one block away so really it is everything you need from a hotel in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: nnparker74
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small, almost shockingly so. But they are very clean and adequate for someone who is out and about in the city. The hotel is very close to two separate subway lines and just a few stops away from all the main tourist areas. The neighborhood itself is very nice, with shops and restaurants. The staff was fine. They brought us a new hairdryer when ours blew out, but otherwise our interaction with them was at a minimum. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “a most dreadful experience”
Reviews.Author: hawkeyeLondon
Reviews.Content: Room was tiny , you could not swing a mouse in it , never mind a cat. No cupboard/ wardrobe in which to hang a suit or shirt, not even a hook to hang a coat on.The shower( there was no bath) only had hot water sporadically. There are no breakfast facilities and no porters to help you with your luggage . All the toilets in the common areas were blocked and constituted a health hazard. The staff at the desk were, to say the least , unhelpful. DO NOT CONSIDER STAYING IN THE BELNORD , IF YOU HAVE BOOKED , CANCEL. IT IS THE WORST AND MOST OVERPRICED HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED IN .

Reviews.Title: “Well located value hotel in need of sound insulation”
Reviews.Author: LondonNifty
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but clean and as opposed to previous reviews I found the service fine, free WiFi in the room brilliant, hotel is nicely located a few yards from the subway, and good value. Only downside is the noise, shame they don't or can't turn the lift signal off at night and wooden floors in the rooms and corridors add to the problem. Overall though not expensive and some great restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect for my Solo World Series Trip”
Reviews.Author: MenaceofEvilside
Reviews.Content: For the price it was perfect! The room was clean. The room came with a private bath. The hotel is a minute walk from the subway, a 24 hour bakery/diner, a 24 hour CVS pharmacy. The room does not come with an alarm. The room does not come with a desk. I stayed in a double. Someone reviewed the place and complained about the hot water - just let it run for a couple of minutes before taking a shower so that it can warm up - no biggie. The AC/Heater is a bit loud so - set your temperature setting if you leave for the day. Besides that - you can't really fault them much for the PRICE! ABSOLUTELY AMAZING PRICE for NYC!

Reviews.Title: “rude at reception!”
Reviews.Author: antiquesed
Reviews.Content: My trip to NY with my brother was supposed to be relaxed. We went to attend our cousins wedding. When we got to the hotel at 7 am they told us our room would only be ready at 12 so, we went out for the morning. At 1 pm, an hour after our room should have been ready, i came to check in and the room wasn't. So, i waited in the lobby for an hour until it was ready. Then i came up to the counter and asked for my key, they said i had to pay first. This was unusual, but i took out my brothers credit card (i paid for the flight, he for the hotel) and handed it to them. They said that because he wasn't there they wouldn't charge it. My brother and I had been there before when we dropped off our luggage, they said it would be fine if i checked in under his name. Now, it wasn't okay and i was in Manhattan and he in New Jersey so i asked for the manager. The manager came out and insisted that my brother be there for them to use the card. I was fed up. I had already been waiting for my room for 7 hours and, i was very tired front jet-lag. I asked for the key to get my bags from the luggage room so i could find another hotel, they promptly refused. I HAVE NEVER HAD SUCH A TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE! THEY WERE RUDE, TELLING ME THEY WERE BUSY AND I WAS WASTING THEIR TIME. (THERE WAS NO-ONE IN THAT TINY LOBBY)! In the end my brother had to come and, be there for there when they swiped the card to hold the money. When we got to the room it was tiny- barely any room to move in. We had to unpack and put our bags in the storage room because there wasn't enough room to move around in with our 2 medium size bags. It was not worth the money and, it wasn't a lot. I WILL NEVER STAY THERE AGAIN AND, I DISCOURAGE ANYONE FROM STAYING THERE. IT'S NOT WORTH THE STRESS, THE NOISE, OR THE INCOMPETENCE OF IT'S EMPLOYEES! (AND THERE WAS NO INTERNET OR BUSINESS CENTER, NO GYM, POOL, OR ROOM SERVICE). One word to describe this hotel would be PATHETIC!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended: basic, clean and quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: STR00P
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet hotel. The room was small and basic, and had a clean private bathroom. If you're just looking for a clean, comfortable place to sleep and shower, this is a perfect choice. The street is quiet, we had our window open during the night! Service: friendly 24/7 staff. No breakfast or any other food service, but coffee places on the block. Luggage storage. They will arrange a private airport shuttle upon your request. Good location: Many dining options, pubs and shops at walking distance, 3 blocks from central park, 2 blocks from a (local) subway line.

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY BAD SHEET and low level service”
Reviews.Author: gabbobboroma
Reviews.Content: I arrive the beds were dirty and the room was very tiny not even if I paid 30 dollars I paid 200 dollars for a small double. The bathroom does not work well either I do not suggest not well managed

Reviews.Title: “Like staying with grandma”
Reviews.Author: ShannaMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: Super clean, TINY room in a safe area with great staff. Cannot stress how small the rooms are, door brushed the bed when entering the room. Grandma's house was always clean & welcoming, but no frills. The internet on the computers available at the hotel is horrible, don't waste your time or money. I don't know about the wifi, I left my laptop at home since the website said they had a computer room. There was a tiny little bit of mold at the very top of the shower but I could tell it had been cleaned up. I've got mild allergies and didn't have any problems but it could be an issue for some. Other than that the room was just as expected/described, clean and small. Comfy bed, small storage/closet area, tiny but private bathroom. The walls are thin, I could hear movement in the morning but the cleaning staff honored my Do Not Disturb sign and stopped chatting when they got near my end of the hall. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone looking to save money & willing to go without the luxuries.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Cosy!!”
Reviews.Author: SMILLIEBUM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of September for 4 nights and had no problems what so ever. The rooms are extremely small and I mean all you can fit in the room is the bed, its the smallest room I have ever seen. However it was very clean and modern, the maids came in every day with new sheets and towels and tidied the room. Most of the hotel staff were friendly and helpfull, but there were some that were ignorant and would look the road you were on, but I suppose you can get that anywhere. The hotel is in a great location, not right in the heart of manhattan but only a 2min sub ride away from time square and the nearest station is only one block up from the hotel, you can also walk to central park from the hotel, which is fab. There is also lots of places close by to eat, the city diner on broadway just a block from the hotel does a fab breakfast, and a brilliant little irish pub called "the Parlour" is situated across the road. All in all if your looking for somewhere purely to put your head down, and dont plan spending to much time in your room, for a really good price and a good location, I think the Blenord is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault management (in our case) for handling a noisy neighbour”
Reviews.Author: ValueValueValue
Reviews.Content: At the last minute, we decided to give ourselves three extra nights in NYC. Because our usual budget choice was booked up, we stayed at the Belnord -- with some hesitation given the mixed reviews. But the room was available at a very attractive price in a nice, quiet neighbourhood very close to the 86th Street subway stop for the no. 1 (local) train -- Times Square is less than 15 minutes away. True to the reviews, the front-desk staff when we checked in could best be described as surly, but the cleaning staff were really friendly (even though the only Spanish I know is "hola" and "gracias"). The room was TINY but actually had a small closet (!!!) and a flat-screen TV. The tip envelopes that I find so annoying were not present here, which perhaps inspired me leave a larger tip than I normally do. Bed bugs were not a problem for us. Thin walls/doors were a problem, however, but when we called the front desk to complain about noise a few doors down, in both instances someone came upstairs RIGHT AWAY to ask the offending party to quieten down. If I could complain about one thing, though, this representative should NOT tell the noisemakers which room lodged the complaint. We didn't face any retribution for our actions, but I still thought it was bad policy.

Reviews.Title: “Clean quiet and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: nadiar910
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for budget travellers. The rooms are small but clean. The hotel location is close to Manhattan. We enjoyed our stay

Reviews.Title: “Very Small - But You'll Like It”
Reviews.Author: dannywoo
Reviews.Content: The 1st impression of the hotel is that the lobby is very clean. Then you open the door and find that there is not much space other than the bed. But surprisingly, I don't mind because it is so tidy and clean. It is just one street next to the subway. It takes only 10-15 minutes to bring you to 42nd street. For the price, it is very reasonable in the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, clean and good hotel close to the Central Park”
Reviews.Author: jcpMontreal
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my 2 very young kids and parents, so we had to take two rooms: a double and a quadruple. The rooms in general are small, but were very clean and pretty new, with flat screen TV on the wall and new bathrooms as well. The big problem of the quadruple room was there is not place to hang the clothes on (no closet, no cupboard, nothing), so it was not comfortable from that perspective. There was no crib at the hotel either (one of my kids is 1). The location of the hotel is very convenient with metro station, restaurants, CVS, etc. around. The car can be parked on the street quiet easily. One of the staff at the front desk was not very polite when dealing with a couple of issues. Value: it was very good, I think it is very difficult to get a similar hotel at that price in Manhattan. Summary: very good hotel for the money you spend. Definitely I would go back if travelling with my wife alone, but not with the complete family.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe and quiet”
Reviews.Author: BobMart
Reviews.Content: Our hotel selection was based almost solely on the reviews we read on Trip Advisor. The Belnord Hotel lived up to expectations. For the money, it was the best deal we have found in Manhattan. The rooms were clean and quiet and the location was safe. For the money we were not expecting a large room. Having visited Manhattan several times from Phoenix we know the amount you pay seems to proportionate to the room size. Therefore, for a nightly fee of less than $100 we knew the room would be small. One word of advice to the management; could you install hooks on the walls and in the bathroom so we can hang our stuff on? Otherwise, very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneLaura
Reviews.Content: This was the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in - very pokey. No amenities, not even a coffee maker. No fridge. No outgoing calls. Very noisy - very thin walls. But a positive - good location - close to Central Park on one side and Hudson River on the other side.

Reviews.Title: “I'd Think Long and Hard.........”
Reviews.Author: just_9
Reviews.Content: bills itself as a boutique hotel, IT IS NOT.......... not quiet, walls are paper thin .......... not accomandating to normal hotel request (extra towels, late checkout)......smallest hoel room and bathroom Ive ever seen...............front desk personnel barely speak english ..............no espn on the tv.................................................. on the plus side is it is cheap with a comfortable bed in a great location

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: me_the_vagabond
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in Belnord for 5 days from May 30 th an we've been really satisfied. I mean it's NYC, so the room was far from a spacious condo. But it was new, clean and quiet. So I can sincerely recommend this hotel for anyone, who's concerned about both money and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Cheap Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bisse88
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Belnord Hotel in 8 days. We booked our stay at Belnords website and the price was 420 dollars each, so very cheap compares too other hotels in New York City. We got a handicaproom, so the room was very big. The service was perfect and there was cleaning every day. The furniture was new and the bathroom was big and also looked new. We can only recommend Belnord Hotel.:)

Reviews.Title: “Renovations are COMPLETE! THIS PLACE IS PERFECT NOW!”
Reviews.Author: AverageJane11
Reviews.Content: If you look at the dates of the vast majority of the bad reviews, you'll find that the Belnord was once a very shabby stay - but they've renovated every inch of this place and now it is bargain hunter's dream come true. Every last thing was BRAND SPANKING NEW. New Hardwood floors = CLEANER THAN THE CARPET AT THE PLAZA I GUARANTEE, because carpets, by their nature, are filthy even when they look clean. NO bedbugs NO stains NO dirt NEW fixtures in the bathroom NEW tiled floor and walls in bathroom New curtain New towels NEW bedding NEW everything. YES there is an elevator Bottom Line: You are paying next to nothing (I paid $75+tax per night) for a room that is perfectly clean and nice. The ONLY reason that it is SO cheap is that it is incredibly, unbelievably and a little bit laughably small. I knew it was going to be small for the price, and my husband and I did laugh a little when we opened the door but in good spirits. If you can handle the smallness, your needs will be met. I hate to say this, but if you are a person of large stature, you may be too uncomfortable in this hotel. I have to laugh at the people who complain about their "view" being a "brick wall". HELLO - you are in New York City where all of the buildings are lined up wall to wall down every street. Were they expecting that every room in the circumference of the hotel faces across the street? Or worse, were they hoping for a 10th story balcony and a view of central park for $75? Please, don't go to a bargain hotel expecting free breakfast, a Ritz Carleton sized room, a glitzy view and free parking. I actually felt like a real New Yorker with my view of that other brick building because there was a pigeon sitting on the sill and it was unique. This place made it possible for us to go to NYC for the weekend. We couldn't have afforded it otherwise. The renovations made this place a gem for those of us with smaller incomes. I would go back - without a doubt. Unless they raise the price too high. PS. Try Tal Bagels (head north on Broadway) for a nice bagel!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: rgillclarke
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 days in May and for the price we paid, we felt that the room was small but clean, tidy and modern. The staff were helpful and it was very well situated, close to Central Park and Broadway. We were pleasantly surprised after reading some of the reviews on here. Would recommend for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-Beware BEDBUGS”
Reviews.Author: TexasCarol
Reviews.Content: The location is great. The room was very small but clean. Nice bathroom, but I found it difficult to manage in such a small space with no closet or hook to hang any clothes on. Liked the wood floors. Beware of the bed bugs. They are really infested with them. We are covered in red itchy spots. I don't think I'll stay there again, couldn't sleep much because of the itching bites.

Reviews.Title: “It's not the SOHO Grand. So what?”
Reviews.Author: chicagonyc
Reviews.Content: I loved this place. I thought it was clean, and modern and the price was right. I figured the rooms would be small, and they were. But seriously, how much room does one need? The neighborhood is awesome and unless you are looking for a Planet Hollywood within arms reach, you won't be disappointed. The train is also right around the corner. And they provide free wifi to boot. I wish all hotels had hardwood floors, it just seems cleaner. I will and have recommended this to all my friends. If you need the stereotypical Time Sq. hotel with a mini bar and room service, this isn't for you. But if you just need a nice clean place to rest your head, I found this to be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “the ripleys believe it or not hotel...belive it this place stinkssss”
Reviews.Author: theprguest
Reviews.Content: as i open the door too the room the room was so small i almost fell out the window ,when i rushed to the bathroom i realize how small it was i had to put one leg inside the bathtub and the other leg outside the room to take a #2,when i was is time to finish my duties the bathtub curtain was to close to the toilet that i accidently stained ,the bed was so uncomfortable and small as i turned to the right my wife fell to the floor hitting her head with the cheap night table,looking at the window was a view of a old man eating soup,when i went down stairs to talk too the manager all he said i dont spieaki in inglish lol...(aint that a something)the tv was placed on a aukward angle that made it uncomfortable to watch the tv this place should be called the whiplash hotel,the hallways where so small we had to walk sideways to reach the elevators...if you are afraid of small places this is the perfect place to bring your claustrophobic enemy...keep away from this hell hole igloos,i rather sleep in the trains at least i know what to expect and fair is just 2.00 dollars....

Reviews.Title: “Dont Ever Stay At This Hotel - They Ripped Me Off!”
Reviews.Author: postscript55
Reviews.Content: This hotel wrongfully charged my credit card for damages to the room they didn't exist. Must be some plan they have to earn extra cash towards the massive amount of construction the hotel was under. When I called them to find out about this charge they simply told me they never charged my card. After a 3 month dispute with my credit card company they then admitted to the charge saying it was from damages on a chair, sheet and towel. They charged me over $300 without my permission or consent, without any real damages! Stay away from this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Mimmmi
Reviews.Content: We were really supriced how nice this place was! Me and my husband stayed at Belnord hotel 19 - 24 of december and we loved it. Ok the room was cold but the blancets in NY are cheep so that was no problem. The room was nice and cosy, tiny but comfortable! The bathroom was spotless and our sheats and towels were changed everyday! The area was nice and everything worked nicely at the hotel. They are renovating it at the moiment so there were workmen running about in the mornings but that did not bother us. So after the renovation it will be a lovely place to stay. The subway was just 2 minutes walk aroud the corner and lots of pubs and restaurants! We will be there again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “there're much better options”
Reviews.Author: jackallaround
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst budget hotels I've ever stayed in. Although the location is really good, just one block away from the subway and walking distance to 24/7grocery stores and Central Park, it isn't worth the money, even if you need to go cheap. The pricy tiny rooms are really COLD and the heater makes a very loud noise which makes it almost impossible to get some good sleep after a long day walking around the city, I know you only use the room for sleeping in, but even this was too much to ask for at this place. Another thing that makes the stay here even worse is the very unfriendly staff, it seemed to us they were there not to be bothered at all. I would definitely not stay there again and not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “might be good in 6 months - avoid until then”
Reviews.Author: tlc73
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location - 2 minutes from subway and less than 10 minutes walk to central park. However it is under construction at present and it looks pretty terrible. we had no idea they were doing renovations when we booked and were pretty disappointed in it. we were on the 4th floor which doesn't have an elevator stop so we had to go up to the 5th floor and walk down a flight of stairs. There were exposed electrical wires hanging out of the walls in the hallways. Constant noise from the power tools being used. The reception people were pretty rude at times. not a good experience, but the rooms that have been renovated looked pretty good, so may be okay when all the work is done.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this flea pit!”
Reviews.Author: DeiseGal
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked this hotel for Monday, September 15th ($300 for the night), and arrived on to this 'building site' early in the morning. It's quite close to Central Park (this hotels only apparent positive) so we took a wander around there and we checked in later on in the afternoon. We had to drag our bags up three flights of stairs as there was no lift (a kind builder helped us!) and the carpets were FILTHY with tiny, claustrophobic hallways. Our room was absolutely appalling - tiny, dirty, a hard bed with an uncomfortable plastic cover on the mattress, a shabby desk and chair with a tiny bathroom. The towels looked very suspect. The room was dark and looked onto an alleyway with an archaic air conditioning unit. We tried to stay out of the room for as long as possible for the day. When we came back, exhausted from our day of sightseeing, there was a fire alarm going off in one of the rooms down the hallway. We visited Reception twice and called them from our room, as did other disgruntled guests we met in the hall. We received a frosty and impatient response that the Maintenance guy would 'look into it' - it took him two hours to do so. After very little sleep, we ran out of this hotel at 8.30am. I made a complaint at Reception but didn't get any satisfaction as they said this hotel was advertised as being under construction and we should have duly received a discount for where we stayed from Expedia - none of this was relayed to me at my time of booking. Who would knowlingly book into a building site? We were eventually given the number for Expedia's Sales Support in the US - after two unsuccessful and stressful 10 minute phone calls, they couldn't even locate us on their system?? I will definitely be following this up with them. I think the positive reviews are for the more updated other side of the hotel (they even have a lift!), but avoid the older side at all costs - particularly if it's going to cost you 300 bills a night.

Reviews.Title: “HellNord!”
Reviews.Author: Nikkina
Reviews.Content: If you like bedbugs, you'll like this hotel. I paid $250 a night for a hotel that had bedbugs, a renovation going on, broken bed light, outlets that didn't work, and a filthy carpet. For a vacation damper, stay at the SmellNord. I knew I would get a small room looking out onto a shaft, as that is what you get in New York City, but the filth, bedbugs and construction were unacceptable. PS Take the toilet paper roll off the dispenser if you like to remain seated while going to the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Like NEw”
Reviews.Author: lizette034
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel 3 nights ... Completely re- done new beds, sheets, floors and bathrooms... Small, but not bad at all ... The lobby was the last part of the hotel being worked on. Smells like new too. Nice area, close to the subway and food. No Bed Bugs like prior reviews. See hotel website, looks exactly like the photo. There is a older side of the building, so make sure you ask for the new renovated section.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cpjess
Reviews.Content: The hotel was under construction when we got there. My boyfriend and I went to nyc for 3days and stayed at the belnord. It was very clean and everyone including maids were very helpful and friendly. Our 1st room was on the 2nd floor but the air conditioning wasn't working properly. They quickly upgraded us to a larger room with a private bath. The location of this hotel is excellent. The only down fall was our new room was on the 5th floor but it was really nice and really clean. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jih117
Reviews.Content: I was extremely disappointed with this hotel. I had made plans to travel to NYC with my boyfriend. We were to go to a Yankees game and then I'd book the Belnord Hotel after. Plans fell through and we missed the game due to very poor directions and when we got to the hotel which had no parking (I had to pay $45 to park my car in a garage overnight after already paying $152.45 for the hotel for one night) it was under construction. We walked down the hallway to the "bedroom" if you can call it that and I just got more disappointed. There was no bathroom in our room but it was down the hall where it had to be shared with others on our floor. The locks didn't even work that well because someone tried coming in while by boyfriend was taking a shower! There was one window in our room and the mini blinds weren't even long enough to go down to the window ledge! So people in the next building could have looked in if I hadn't blocked the opening with the towels and our bags. Then all that was in the room was the double bed, 2 small endtables (one on either side of the bed) and a very small "closet". There was only about a foot or maybe a foot and a half from the end of the bed to the wall and that's all there was to the room!!! The bed was hard and very uncomfortable. There was a tv in the room but in order to watch it you had to sit in a very uncomfortable position which hurt my neck. To only make things worse I was awakened in the middle of the night by the guest in the next room snoring. That's how thin the walls were. Then I heard all the construction workers very early and even though I had the "do not disturb" sign on the door, the maid STILL knocked twice asking if we needed the room cleaned. Are you kidding me? It says do not disturb so please don't!!! But it didn't really matter because I still heard the vaccum running. I'm glad we were only staying for one night and hadn't booked it for a week. I would not recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location,but stay at Your Own Risk!”
Reviews.Author: 0_Globe_Trotters_0
Reviews.Content: Location The location on this hotel is excellent, its about 10 min walk (if that) from Time Square. If you walk down broadway there are many shops to keep you entertained as your walking down. Room Very basic, No bugs, double bed, small storage cupboard, dressing table, Tv, air con, Small but "VERY" clean bathroom. No safe! Hotel I found the hotel basic but it was perfect for somewhere to crash down of a night, Although i was very disappointed with the service we recieved during our stay. Maids where friendly, as i later found, they had stolen shoes and a bag , that i's left in my room. We complained and they did nothing to compensate. I stay at this hotel AT YOUR OWN RISK,and take your passports out with you wherever you go. Tips on staying in New york * Walk everywhere IF POSS * If going during winter, take Extra warm clothes and layers. *Tax and Tips will be added to eveything *If getting Taxi's just get the yellow cabs Hope this review has helped, thanx for your time!

Reviews.Title: “Probably worth it if saving $50 - $100/night is important to you.”
Reviews.Author: Hilltraveler
Reviews.Content: We saw no bug during the week we stayed at the Belnord in March, 2008. That was important to me. We had a room with a double bed and a private bath, which was also important since we are older than most of the Belnord customers and use the bathroom frequently during the night. Our bathroom was new and spotlessly clean, though tiny, like everything else in this hotel. If you want a bath, you will have to sit with your knees bent. The shower, however, was nice. The sheets were clean. The maid service was nice and friendly, though we were given only one wash cloth daily, sometimes none, and our plastic glasses were not replenished. The room was about 9 feet by 10 or 11 feet, which included the closet and bathroom. The double bed was very small, and the pillows were about an inch thick. Everything in the room was of cheap quality. There was one bedside table and a small desk, both of pressed wood with some of the veneer chipped off. There was one straight-backed wooden chair with a filthy stained seat cover. The carpeting was filthy and stained; the wallpaper was hanging loose in a couple places around the window. There was a plastic zip-up mattress cover on the mattress, for which I was grateful, knowing that is a way to help prevent bed bugs. Outside air came right in around the window air-conditioner, though it did not matter to us in March because the room was warm enough to sleep in. When we turned on the heat briefly, the clanging in the pipes was loud and quite amusing. It wouldn't be amusing, though, if you actually needed heat and had to leave it on. The halls are very narrow; if you stick out your elbows, they will touch each wall ( and I am only 5'4") - but who cares how wide the halls are? If you are obese, or very tall, you will not be comfortable here, however. So why would one stay at the Belnord? Amazingly, $150/night is cheap in NYC, especially for this area. The location is wonderful, my favorite area in NYC. There are scores of good cafes and restaurants on Broadway and more on Amsterdam, between which this hotel is located. It is close to subway stations, the Natural History museum, Central Park, Zabars. We spent some time in the Barnes and Noble nearby and found the entertainment for the evening was a group of Times Square actors reading parts from short plays. We were eating in a small local restaurant with great inexpensive food when Jerry Stiller came in and sat down for dinner (George Costanza's dad on Seinfeld and actor Ben Stiller's real-life dad). If you need to "do New York" as cheaply as possible, this is a good option. Our bed and bathroom were clean, and we were able to sleep here in a terrific location for at least $50/night less than any other place other than a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MoominTraveller
Reviews.Content: We found the Belnord to be good value for money. The room we had was extremely small, but that didn't matter to us since we were in New York to experience the city, not hang out in our hotel room. We'd leave at about 9 or 10 each morning and return at 10 or 11 at night. The bathroom on our floor (shared, across the hall) was immaculately clean at all times, and had brand new fixtures. Our room itself had older carpets and furnishings, but it was clean. The service was good, and the staff were accommodating. The location was the best thing about the hotel. We were in a very safe, really nice Upper West Side neighbourhood near Central Park. It was very close to good restaurants and shops, and had easy access to the subway. There is a good drop-off laundry service right next door to the Belnord. We found it very useful. They wash, dry, and fold for you, and charge reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Look for another place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lkaner
Reviews.Content: It's close to a subway station, a deli and a drugstore. The outside hotel and its area are ok, but the inside is a mess and smells to mould. The rooms are very small but we didn't expect more and the bathroom is clean. I am sure its written somewhere but we didn't pay attention there's no lift. Altough we've complained, they never turned the heating on and believe me it was too cold in early december, so we had to leave New York one day earlier and we've got no refund.

Reviews.Title: “What more did you expect?!!?!!!”
Reviews.Author: HS1984
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at Belnord from the 19th - 23rd December 2007, we booked Belnord through Expedia, we choose this hotel purely on price, as it was an absolute bargin copared to the other prices, we worked out it was about £30 a night!!! After looking into the hotel we saw it was in a very good location but then started reading reviews about bed bugs and rude staff we began to worry!........ BUT..... upon arrival (quite late at night and with the flu) we found the man at reception to be extremely friendly and helpful. Must admit when we saw the room we did laugh as it was quite small, just enough rom to walk around the bed with a bedside table a tv and a small cupboard..... as our trip was or only 4 days all we required really was a bed to sleep in at night and this is what we got. The room was very clean and was cleaned and had the sheets and towels changed everyday. And concerning the bedbugs..... we did not see one for the entire stay. On our floor there were about 5 bathrooms and toilet rooms, almost enough for one to every room, there was always a bathroom free when you needed and they were very clean. On one ocassion the radiator dial snapped off, went down to reception and th "fix it" guy came up literally staight away and sorted it out!!!! Get the subway everywhere from 86th, just down the road, save your money on taxis and eat at the Olive Garden in Times Square!!!!! We think this hotel has been given a pretty hard time considering how cheap it was... you get what you pay for!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Service or policy”
Reviews.Author: Canyouu
Reviews.Content: We had planned our trip to NY and was excited about our visit our plans were to conduct some business and enjoy visiting our friends, Due to unforeseen weather conditions, our trip had to be canceled, the Belnord Hotel, sees it fit to charge for one night's accommodation, for events totally out off our control. The air line issues a credit at no additional charge, If you rely on customers coming back repeat business, in which I will visiting NY on several occasions, I am sure a credit can be issued or at best refund, under any other conditions that might be controllable I can understand such policies. However the weather is not one of them. I think that taking money from your clients is not best business practices. When it comes to service, zero, when it comes to policy 110%, I am sure I will not refer any of my clients or customer to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!!!”
Reviews.Author: chicagogirl29
Reviews.Content: This hotel was by far the nastiest hotel I have ever stayed in. I rated it a one, however, it is not even deserving of that. The room I booked was so small that basically all that COULD fit in it was a bed. To watch the TV, you would have to put your head at an uncomfortable angle, as it was suspended from the ceiling. There was long black hair in the bed, and the room smelled of what I do not know. I complained and was upgraded to the "best room available". This room was somewhat better, but on the way to the room I spotted a cockroach crawling up the wall. I brought the manager to see the roach, and he did not seem to care. In the room, there were stained towels on the bed, and again the long black hair. There was no elevator, and the carpets looked like they should have be replaced years ago. There were holes in the floors, which I assumed had something to do with the repairs. We checked our bags at checkout, and they charged $5.00 to hold them, and there was no bellman to carry bags. I cancelled the rest of the reservation, and by the end of it all my friend and I renamed the hotel to Hotel Hellnord. I wouldn't leave an animal in such a place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent deal”
Reviews.Author: some_bus
Reviews.Content: I found my room clean and pleasant, and I actually ended up spending a lot more time there than I expected because I had work to do and they had fast wireless Internet (for $10 a day). The bathrooms were fine too. It's no frills, but quite liveable. I experienced none of the problems other reviewers reported. There was dust in the hallways because they were undergoing a major renovation, but that didn't affect the areas I occupied.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away - Book somthing else”
Reviews.Author: SimonHunter
Reviews.Content: Where to start – just avoid this hotel. The outside looks okay, but on arrival you will realise this is not worth the money. The staff are extremely rude and unhelpful, but you could look past that if the hotel was at least clean. The rooms are awful and filthy, with dirty un-cleaned carpets and even filthier bed sheets. The beds are tiny with hard mattresses that are covered with PLASTIC sheets. These sheets are extremely uncomfy and very noisy when you move. All the pipes in the bathroom were sticking out loose from the wall, ie. Shower head hung off the wall, taps spun round on the ends of the pipes and mould grew round the edges of the bath. All halls are filthy and absolutely stink of smoke – the room was meant to be non-smoking, but all they did was spray overpowering sickly air freshener around. The room was literally 2 single beds and no room to move. We had to look through our suitcases on the bed as nowhere to unpack. When we went to checkout we asked if we could leave our luggage for a few hours – we were told they CHARGE!!! to store luggage in a room that anyone could access. We hastily left and will never book a room with them again. It is quite close to a tube station, but not on the express – stay either a few blocks higher or lower these are better for the express.

Reviews.Title: “Belnord - not the Ritz, but doesn't pretend to be”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELLINGALONE068
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Belnord one night. It was cheap for NY so I didn't expect 5 star accommodation. It's true the room was minuscule, the aircon growled and burped all night, and the bathroom was down the hall. But my bed was comfortable and clean, and the hotel staff gave useful advice when I needed it. A porter carried some of my stuff up to the 4th floor. While I wouldn't want to commit myself to a lifetime at the Belnord, I thought it gave me basically what I needed, a roof over my head and clean bed-linen

Reviews.Title: “No problems”
Reviews.Author: Duchess-On
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful weekend in NYC (Oct. 12-15, 2007). My stay at the Belnord Hotel was fine. The staff (front desk & housekeeping) were courteous and helpful. I booked a double bed with ensuite bathroom and all was well. I had read previous reviews before my departure and so was on the look out for bedbugs. I am glad to say i did not encounter any. As others have said before me, the location of this hotel is optimal for a stay in New York City (upper west side Manhattan). I walked to and through Central Park and down Fifth Avenue from the hotel. Also the 86th St. subway line is just steps away. I felt relatively safe traveling the subway in the evenings and walking back to the hotel. For its affordability, I would consider returning to the Belnord. for future stays in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Bugs for this price (200.00$)”
Reviews.Author: MarinoT
Reviews.Content: We were not in New York for the hotel. The place was acceptable. The bed bugs were not. Good memories of biking New York but itching for a week, paying 200.00$ a night was not. We are not the first to complain. Nothing have been done. Stay away until the bugs are gone. Marino

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: peeps33
Reviews.Content: I would give this hotel -100 They screwed up my reservation so I ended up wasting $300 dollars when i didn't even get to check in. DON'T STAY HERE. And if you call in, don't trust the receptionists because they basically LIED and i got my ENTIRE reservation screwed up. The receptionists are very rude too. I would just spend more money and stay at a better place. STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “for the price its great”
Reviews.Author: tyrlo
Reviews.Content: very convient accomdation.out the door,to left and 5 mins was centeral park. To the right was uptown broadway street with a subway to take you anywhere within the city.Accomdation ideal for money if you plan on been out and about all day. Room was small but clean and shared bathroom was immac with no problems from other guests. situated in quite street. No problems with traffic. Ideal for those on a budget

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs 'R Us!!!”
Reviews.Author: dharma69
Reviews.Content: I thought that I'd give this place a try in order to save a few dollars. Big mistake on my part. I've never run hotel and you can call me crazy but I just don't think there's any excuse for bugs infesting a bed that I sleep in or for those bugs feasting on me while I sleep as I wound up itching and covered in bites including on my face. I was moved and occupied 3 different rooms during my 7-day stay. Wrong answer. As for the rooms themselves, consider yourself lucky if you have a closet to store your belongings and if the carpet is clean. Try not to get neck strain while watching the television that's at ceiling level. Try meditation in order to relax on their most uncomfortable beds. And "service" is not this place's middle name. So that's what equates a "budget hotel"? Sad. Ironically, the one thing that you'd think would be a problem (shared bathrooms) wasn't. They were fine, clean and there were 3 or 4 on every floor. On the bright side, the location is great. I love the Upper West side, but that's about all I can offer as an endorsement for the Belnord. Unless you only other option is sleeing on the subway, don't stay at the Belnord.

Reviews.Title: “Infested Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mr_P_Winchester_MA
Reviews.Content: From the outside the hotel did not look bad, we were a party of 4. The room I was given looked like the carpet was not cleaned for months, the telephone initially did not work but then it was fixed after having an argument with the night porter who was telling me I did not know how to use the phone. There was no remote control for the TV despite asking for one. Worst of all one person in our party found a bed bug on her pillow, when complaining another women complained that she had many bed bugs in her bed and she was bitten in many places. After all that I did not bother about telling them the air conditioning did not work. We left the hotel in a taxi booked by them (the best part of the visit, both taxi and leaving the hotel). We have since found out that this problem has been going on for some time without the hotel doing anything to resolve this, I think they should be forced to close and then be fumigated before they are permitted to reopen. I know hotels can easily get this problem due to different people staying there and taking appropriate action to resolve the problem is acceptable but it is not acceptable to carry on without resolving this problem. I have had to spray my case and contents and put all clothes in the wash in order to prevent anything getting into my home (I should not have to do this). This is not a fake review it is totally factual. To sum it up, I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Mice on Broadway!”
Reviews.Author: Flatliner69
Reviews.Content: New York rooms are expensive and as has been stated by others, this hotel offers some of the cheapest non hostel type rooms around so expectations weren't high. First impressions were favourable. Location was great and even the view over the piles of basins and toilets from a refurbishment didn't seem too bad so long as you kept the blinds down. We had en-suite facilities but there were plenty of communal bathrooms which were kept clean and were never in use when we walked past them. All was well until our third night when I was roused by a rustling noise on the bedside table. When the light went on we found an unopened packet of crisps had been gnawed into and there was a smattering of crisps on the top of the unit. Further investigation showed a mouse under some bags in the corner of the room which disappeared when it was disturbed. The night receptionist initially said that he could not move us as there were no free rooms but conceeded under pressure and we were given a miniscule room with less than two feet of space on either side of the bed. The mattress was covered with plastic and then only one thin sheet which led to a very uncomfortable night and the air conditioning unit was so noisy that all chance of sleep was lost. To top it all ,we saw in the morning that the clothes cupboard was equipped with it's very own bait box so obviously rodents are not an uncommom site in the Belnord's rooms. Having said all of this, we did have a great stay in New York (THANK YOU, KEVIN ) . Just be aware that if you were concerned by the reports of the bed bugs there are other more terrifying creatures lurking in the fabric of this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Bargain”
Reviews.Author: Jolene_Slack
Reviews.Content: We weren't sure what to expect for the price, as it is pretty much the cheapest hotel that's not a hostel on Manhatten. The location is superb, great subway links and a short walk from Central Park. Leonardo Di Caprio was even filming a new film across the road while we were there. The room was small, but aren't they all in NYC? It was clean, with a daily maid service, a good air conditioning unit, and a small TV with a good selection of channels. There was a built in wardrobe and separate cupboard for your luggage. I was really worried about a shared bathroom, but there were 4 bathrooms on my floor and there was always one free even at peak times. The bathrooms were always sparkly clean. Whilst there isn't a bar or a big lobby area, there are vending machines and a very smiley man on reception. I would recommend this hotel to couples and singles, but not if you have mobility issues, as there was no lift.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel, but they probably have bugs”
Reviews.Author: StockholmNoah
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel a couple of months ago and booked it right away. the price and location were just what I was looking for. After paying in full I started reading reviews. Had I done this first I would not have chosen this hotel. All the reviews about bedbugs scared me but I'm too cheap to change my reservation and I knew I wouldn't find a hotel on the upper west side for the same price, so I decided to risk getting bedbugs. Before my trip I spent many hours reading about bedbugs and I got really scared of bringing them home with me. When I got to the Belnord our room was on the fifth floor(no elevator) but that didn't bother me considering the price. Our room wasn't too small and It was fairly clean. I immediately looked behind headboards and in drawers for signs of bed bugs and all I found was a few black spots that could have been bed bug droppings (They looked exactly like pictures I've seen on the internet.) We slept with the lights on and kept our hard plastic suitcase (which is almost air tight) closed at all times. The first night as I was trying to sleep I noticed a blood stain on the wall right next to my bed which was the same size and shape as the stains I'd been warned about on the internet. During our one week stay we got a couple of bites that probably were from bed bugs but that's it. Bugs that aren't very hungry won't come out if it's light, or so I've read. I don't think we brought any bugs home with us and overall the hotel was great. But I felt worried about bed bugs for months so I'm still not sure if it was worth it. If you are deciding wheather or not to book this hotel read reviews on this site for a couple hours first. Then read about bed bugs. If you're not scared of bed bugs, this hotel is perfect for the budget traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Hated this place”
Reviews.Author: charli7
Reviews.Content: Despite reading awful reviews on this place my boyfriend and i decided to give it the benefit of the doubt - what a mistake!! We could barely get out bags in the door of the room it was that small! The bed had the grottiest sheet on which was stained so we used our sleeping bag liners instead. The bathroom could barely fit one person in let alone two and it had the smallest bath ive ever seen i dont think you could even call it a bath! The staff on reception were rude (apart from 1 girl) and would not give change for using THEIR washine machines they made us walk down to the shop. Once we had walked down to the shop and put our washine in the machine we realised they were so tight that all the machines worked on a COLD WASH ONLY and so our washing came back out dirty and im not joking!! We paid £250 for 3 nights stay here and i would never ever go back or recommend it to anyone. The only good thing is that it is central and just off broadway.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price, top location too”
Reviews.Author: LondonBeaker
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great - after worrying what it would be like after reading the reviews on here, we were pleased with our choice. So close to the subway. lots of shops & eateries, so easy to get around. The room was smallish, but big enough for us and our bags with ample storarge. It was clean. The plastic sheets around the bed were a bit annoying, but it did not ruin our stay by any means. The hotel is well equipped with internet, phones, vending machines if needed and I thought the staff were very helpful if needed. Would recommend this hotel - no problem. Is lovely to stay up near Central Park too.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: pooh8
Reviews.Content: I was nervous because of the mixed reviews,on this site and others and often put aside things stated by people being far too fussy, perhaps they should be staying in 5 star Hotels instead of 1 star (with the equivalent prices of course.) For the money I do not know if you could get any better, the bathrooms were very clean, I found the staff very pleasant, but I was not asking for any services. ( I do not think one should expect this at the price one is paying here) There was an unusual smell, but it was not totally unpleasant, but I was on the ground floor so cannot comment on any other part of the hotel perhaps someone had brought in an Indian curry or something, so without airing out the rooms with the doors and windows open any odors left over may very well linger, and again for the money I did not find it something worth worrying about and after all I was in New York with so much to do. I did take my own silk sleeping bag and use this as I was concerned about the reports I had read. I checked out the bed as suggested and found nothing the first night or the second night on my third night I found something tiny and dead on the sheet, but refused to think about it I had one more night to sleep there. On my last morning (3 nights) I found 3 tiny dead bugs under my sleep sack, Now I checked the bed every night before going to bed so they appeared thru the night. I decided to have the hottest shower possible and leave asap I had been warned and because of finances chose to ignore this. If it had not been for the dead bugs I would have rated this place above average for New York prices, but sadly it REALLY does look like they have a bad problem with bugs, the sheets were changed every day and the mattress was encased in plastic as someone else said, but I still found bugs, I am still scratching but of course it is all in the mind!! New York is a great place to visit and I felt very safe as an older female solo traveler., I would not hesitate to go again but hopefully next time I can afford at least the standard of Holiday Inn Express which I guess I am going to have to pay around $300.00 per night(for the equivalent in Manhattan) and not $119.00 as I paid at The Belnord. I cannot say it was awful, but if I had a car at the door I would have probably not booked in, and gone looking elsewhere, but as my first trip to new york I neither wanted to spend the time or the money, as The Lion King, Inherit the Wind , an evening cruise on the Hudson, and many other delights may not have happended.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Matt2323
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for nearly 2 months to do some travelling around New York and other areas, i stayed here from the 26th of Febuary to the 7th of April, i stayed in two different rooms because i made 2 seperate reservations (because i was staying longer than 28 days), and both rooms were perfect. There were no bedbugs. The rooms were cleaned every single day by friendly maids, every member of staff here are friendly and kind. The location is amazing, the subway is literally 40 steps away! Its on the same block as the hotel, the subway train "1, 2 and 3" line, which takes you from the hotel, through times sqaure, all the way downtown to the world trade site. The hotel is in a very safe area, in my whole 2 months i did not have any trouble at all, the hotel is right on broadway! I beleive its one of the safest areas in the city (upper west side on broadway). I was very pleased to find a lobby with a fast computer with the internet, and some vending machines, the internet is nice and cheap to use. Bathrooms were always empty when i wanted to use them, there were 5 bathrooms to each floor, all the bathrooms are spotlessly clean, and they are cleaned daily by the maids. In the whole time i was there, the bathrooms were always empty so you can have hot showers or baths anytime you wish. All the rooms have TV's with many stations, and a phone, and icebox to keep your items cold if needed. There are no bedbugs here. I am very impressed with this hotel, and i will always stay there again when i go back to New York, it really is an amazing city! Matthew Holland

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhh!!! Claustrophobic Dorm.”
Reviews.Author: megskathy
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel, in January not expecting greatness. It was only $400 for 4 nights, which is a steal for NYC!! It is also in an excellent location. I was worried about bedbugs, but decided to risk it. We arrived Saturday night. There are 2 stairways, and apparently the other stairway leads to creepy abandoned rooms. More on that later. We climbed the EXTREMELY NARROW stairs up to floor 5. (No one helped the two of us carry our 4 bags up the 5 flights!!) I felt extremely claustrophobic here. The wall enclosures around the stairs are very close. We got to the room, opened the door, and the perimeter of the bed was about a foot smaller than the perimeter of the room. Also, it was snowing outside, but it was so suffocatingly hot in the room that we had to turn on the air conditioner. So it was small and suffocating-great combo!! Down the hall, another tenant was blasting techno music and occasionally strolling down the hall barefoot-flashbacks to my freshman dorm room. Clearly this guy was living here. Then I went to the bathroom. I am very petite and the toilet was facing the wall with about an inch of space between the toilet and the wall. I had trouble squeezing into that space, so I can't imagine how anyone else manages. Also, there was no soap or towel in the restroom, meaning that everyone else there is NOT WASHING THEIR HANDS after using the facilities. YUCK. After about 20 minutes, we called my brother (who lives in Brooklyn) to come meet us. He apparently went up the other staircase, which led him to some creepy torn down area of the building that was reminiscent of "The Shining." Also, it was comforting to know that someone without a room key could stroll in the hotel and hang out on the floors-and even use the bathrooms! (Attention New Yorkers: Here is a public restroom alternative to McDonald's!!!)Top-notch security in place. I tried to show my brother the tiny weird bathroom (it was adjacent to my room and any noises in there could be heard very clearly). I pressed the door, which was unlatched, and someone was INSIDE and slammed it shut!! Who goes to the bathroom without closing the door or locking it??? In a hotel with shared bathrooms?? And you know he didn't wash his hands afterwards!! This hotel was all kinds of creepy and uncomfortable. I cannot stress enough the absurdity of requiring a/c in FREEZING COLD TEMPERATURES!!! I felt like I was being smothered with a hot blanket. YUCK. DO NOT STAY IN THIS TINY PIECE OF HELL. ENROLL IN COLLEGE AND LIVE IN A DORM ROOM INSTEAD. (actually, even my dorms were much nicer and better than this crappy dump.)

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: jocker1980
Reviews.Content: great place for those who are coming to visit NYC for the first time. bus M60 from laguardia airport takes you almost to the hotel, and the subway is very close too. that makes easy going aroung and get back to hotel at any time. rooms are average, clean enough, nothing special, but enough for pleasant staying. bed thing is they do not have breakfast unlike most of European hotels. hotel is settled in peaceful and safe area (upper west side) and central park is only few blocks away. you can walk to Metropolitan museum that is just across the central park. nice place to stay in NYC

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: hurl_me
Reviews.Content: We read mixed reviews about this hotel and was hesitant to book. The location was the really the only reason we did book. We had our fingers crossed that we hadnt made a mistake. We were pleasantly surprised! Very clean hotel and rooms. There was never a wait for the shared bathrooms and they were also very clean. The staff is friendly and helpful. GREAT location. Step out of the hotel and you are ready to walk anywhere! The Park is like 3 blocks away, Museum of Natural History is close too. CVS drugstore across the street. Great eateries and shopping all over. It was nice to take in the excitement of the city and come back to a quiet, neighborhood. We had a very comfortable stay and would stay again. The price cant be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in NYC”
Reviews.Author: roxy100198
Reviews.Content: The hotel Belnord was a great pick for us. The location was wonderful. Great eats and shopping right near by. We loved the "Hot and Crusty" pizzeria that was only a block away. The room was small but that was to be expected. Staff was friendly and assisted us with luggage and helpful in locating near by points of interest. Maid service was timely and provided us with clean linings on a daily basis. Room was a little hot at times even with the radiator off. Only downfall to the hotel was there was no elevator however we were aware of this before arrival. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to New York on a budget. We chose to go New Years Eve weekend so it was a bit pricier then normal, $220 a night. However we enjoyed the hotel and the neighborhood. Will def stay again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel for the price!!! Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Bossk
Reviews.Content: Despite the reviews about bedbugs I read on this Hotel, I can say that I stayed goodly from 12-1-06 'tiil 12-06-06 in this beautiful hotel! Ok you get what you pay for but the room is clean, comfortable, not very big but it's ok! NO bedbugs or something else absolutely! Personal is very kind, you can ask about whatever you need! Located on 87st, a very quite zone full of shops and services, in 10 metro train minutes, you get at Times Square, the heart of New York city. I recommend this place to everyone who wants to stay in Mahn with a small budget. Me and my girlfriend stayed 5 nights greatly! The day we left they kept our luggage until Supershuttle-totheairport arrived and we could even use a bath if needed! Unfortunately this hotel in not provided of any lift! But this is the only bad thing about! G.

Reviews.Title: “excellent holiday”
Reviews.Author: bignells
Reviews.Content: my friend and i have just returned from a wonderful week in new york. it was our first visit and wont be the last. the hotel was just what we expected for the price we paid we had a big room with twin beds and our own bathroom. the room was clean and the linen was changed daily. the shower was excellent with plenty of hot water. the only thing that was missing was a kettle( but this is an english thing). our only complaint was the hairdryer didnt work despite reporting it at the beginning of the week, still this was minor thing. the hotel is excellent for its location as the subway was only a block away on 86thstreet and a 7day metropass cost us 24usd and we went everywhere. the cafe down the road called 82 was excellent for breakfast which we used everyday and cost us about 5 usd this filled us up till evening. we recommend the 2 day greyline bus pass which was 49usd and this covered the uptown and downtown loops on an open air bus this is the way to see new york as you can hop on an off where you want. we did all the sites and the last day we were armed with our shopping lists and went shopping macys if you go to the visitors centre you get a card for a 11% discount this is valid for a year whereas bloomingdales is only for that day. we ate mostly in times square at a place called BBQ the meals were hot, hugh and cheap the service was excellent in every place we went to and it was safe to walk about as there were so many police. the statin island ferry is good as it is free and you can come straight back and the view from the empire state building is awlsome but make sure it is clear or your see nothing. we were lucky with the weather as it was fairly warm and only rained two evenings but was clear the next day. make sure you take a street map that you can read, get a subway map as it is easy to use and good walking shoes. we read all the safety instructions and the rule of thumb is be careful dont take unnecessary risks we used yellow cabs from jfk as these are licenced and charge a set price to manhatten. to our hotel it was 49usd but the journey was an hour and we did get there at midnght. we had a fabulous time but was shattered when we came home but it was well worth it and we found all new yorkers that we met when we looked lost to be friendly and helpful and it was so reasurring to see so many police, perhaps this is what we need. our flight there and back was with air india and despite the 6 hour delay going it wasnt to bad except that no one takes notice of the safety notice or the seatbelt signs as people were getting up using the toilets and getting things out of the lockers before we landed. we prebooked our meals on their web site and this is excellent as we had good meals, (no curries for breakfast like my husband thought) the plane did have pillows and blankets and could spread out on the way back so it was a plesant flight. on the whole we had a very good experience and a good holiday and will come back

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: n8vNYr
Reviews.Content: This hotel was much better than the reviews I've read. The bathroom were exceptionally clean! The rooms are no smaller than any European hotel - why do you need a huge room anyway - you only sleep there! The location is the jewel of this hotel. Upper West Side; within a few minutes walk of 2 subway lines, quiet neighborhood for NY and several eateries and shops. I'd use this hotel again in a NY minute!

Reviews.Title: “Well...”
Reviews.Author: glmz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were going to New York for the very first time. I found Belnord and thought wow this is very cheap, so I booked it. After that I started reading the reviews and I got really scared. I didn't want to sleep somewhere that has bugs!!! I didn't find anything the last minute so we had to go there. My expectations were extremely low so I was some what pleasantly surprised when we were in the lobby. The two men who were in the reception gave us a bad first impression. They felt very unprofessional and kept making mistakes and apologizing. Our room was on the 4th floor and it was tiny!! I don't mind really, but when there might be bed bugs it doesn't sound at all appealing. The one huge plus was that the bathroom was right next to us and it was clean most of the time (unless the guys opposite the bathroom had already taken a shower, then it was dirty...). For the first three nights we slept with the lights off, then when on the third morning I found one tiny bedbug and killed it, we slept the rest of the nights (11!!) with the lights on. We found one bed bug after that but had no bites anywhere. When we got home, my husband had some in his waist and I found two in my leg. But that was all. I covered myself up pretty well and used this bug protection liquid on my skin. hehe. It smelled funny in the room and the air conditioner made a huge noise. When we were checking out, they made us pay $5/BAG (!!!!!!) to keep in the luggage room!!!!! So in total we had to pay $20!!!!! That was insane. I felt the people in the reception were always unprofessional and felt to me like they didn't know how to help and made me feel like I was dumb even asking. Overall I am happy we didn't have a bigger problem with the bedbugs but the next time I visit New York I will definitely NOT stay here. The only good thing about this hotel is the location, it's absolutely PERFECT!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Linkway
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was perfect form beginning to end. The room itself is great with a very nice bathroom and cable TV. The room is clean and smells pretty good! The hotel staff were very nice. They tried there best to meet our demands. They helped us also with info on how to get around the city. GREAT STAFF. PLus it is located right next to a subway !!! i recommend this hotel to everyone!!! Have fun in New York!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best avoided”
Reviews.Author: jhoult
Reviews.Content: Hotel reservation made and deposit paid to Ratestogo. On arrival at the hotel, they said they did not have a reservation for me. They then found the reservation but didn't have a room available for me. Without too much discussion a room was found for me, but they couldn't honour the rates I had been quoted. We then renegotiated rates. On receiving credit card statement, I found that they pushed through an extra transaction for about $90 without my knowledge. I am advised by my credit card company that hotels can "finalise" the account up to 90 days after checking out and the hotel claims the receptionist made an error, so I can't claim a refund. At the time the extra transactioon was processed I was staying in the hotel, so asking my authority would not have been a problem if the charge had been acceptable to me.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT place to stay with a budget in mind”
Reviews.Author: cpbrockman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a place to stay for five nights for our trip into NYC for the first time. A good rule of thumb that I found was fairly accurate was the number of stars a hotel claims to be, add two zero's onto the end of that to get your minimum nightly stay (ie: 2.5 stars = $250 per night). That's how it worked for us ... anyway, I found the Belnord through tripadvisor and ended up booking 5 nights there. A little about The Belnord hotel: to keep cost down, don't get the bathroom in your room, you get 4 bathrooms per floor of about +/- 10 rooms each. There is no elevator and smaller hallways. The room we had was roughly 8' x 12', enough for one double bed, a nightstand and not much walking room. The pillows were flat and bed was pretty hard. We packed a third suitcase with extra pillows and an extra sheet. We had ZERO problems with bugs as others claim. Bathrooms were very clean, no problems with waiting for others to get out. We paid $115 a night. We only slept in the room, our days and evenings were spent adventuring all over Manhattan. We flew into La Guardia airport, closest (and probably cheapest) to Manhattan. It was a $30 cab ride (incl. tolls & tip) from the airport to the Upper West Side where this hotel is. After you pick up luggage, DO NOT GO WITH THE PEOPLE TRYING TO SELL YOU THE SHARED RIDE OR DIRECT TRIP. They quoted us $55 plus tolls (we went through one toll, $4.50 I believe). We found a line that about 10-15 others were standing in and there was a guy hailing cabs for us - hence the $30 cab ride. The Belnord is one block from the subway, get a pocket map of the subway system and manhattan, it'll be your best friend. If you are there for 4 or more nights/days buy the unlimited subway pass for $24. It is $2 per person per ride no matter how far you ride on the subway. Good rule of thumb to begin at is you'll need to go atleast twice a day on it, from and to the hotel. We made the mistake of thinking we wouldn't use it as much as we did ... we're going to get the unlimited next time. You might be able to get away with getting one card and sharing it ... For Dave Letterman or Conan tickets, which are free, the further in advance you can try and request dates for, do it. At the beginning of October, for example, Conan was booked out until mid/late November. Although you can get standby tickets. Get to the NBC Studios Rainbow Room (outside, underneath the sign, on the Today show side) at around 7:30ish (in the morning) for the standby handout at 9:00am to have an excellent shot of seeing his show. For Letterman, you request online and they call you prior to the requested date, otherwise he has standy tix too. SNL tix get about 100,000 requests per year and they can only satisfy 8000 of them per season. Standby tickets for those get handed out on Saturday morning but people get in line on Friday early afternoon. If you like the Today show you can get there about 6:30am and have an another awesome chance of being right up against the gate they put up. We made it on national TV! For the Letterman fans, we went to Hello Deli and ate lunch there and also met Rupert! Nice guy! Good lunch too. There are so many restaurants to choose from it is crazy. We are in our mid-twenties and we liked Greenwich Village the best. It is trendier, more active and offers local night life as compared to touristy nightlife, lots of good restaurants and quite a few bars. John's pizza just by Times Square off Broadway to the East is very good pizza. Ask any local in/around Times Square and they should be able to tell you where it is at exactly. I'd definately recommend this: we bought for $77 a piece a guided tour of Lower Manhattan, Upper Manhattan on a double decker bus. Be forewarned, bring some ones for a tip to the tour guide/driver, especially if they have done a great job. This was on the red bus, there is also a blue bus that does the same thing. Included in our $77 was also tickets to the Empire State Building observation deck and the Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island. We saved about $10 pp doing that. This was good for 2 full days but they signed it for an additional day for us. PLUS you can get off and back on at any one of their MANY stops for free.

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favor and DON'T STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: islandjack
Reviews.Content: I was in town for business and booked 2 rooms here for colleague and myself through expedia. While there the president was in town thus booking solid most NYC hotels. I had confrimation of 2 rooms there and when I arrived at 9pm. They told me that they only had 1 room and that the other was in their system as a "no-show." Well, standing there I found it hard to believe that I was a "no-show" considering they still had my other room available. When I asked to just give me another room they told me "sorry, we're sold out." Thankfully my colleague had friends in the city who he called and stayed with and I got the joy of staying at the Belnord. As I walked up the stairs to my room I noticed the domestic dispute between the couple across the hall which was heard all night through both doors. After making myself comfortable in the box they consider a room I called the front desk to order a wake up call because there was no clock/alarm in the room. I noted that the bathroom was so small that sitting on the toilet your shoulder touches the wall and the other sholder is hanging over the tub (I'm not a big guy either; 5-11 180lbs.) While sitting you can outstretch your arm and be well over the sink (measures about 2x1 ft. While attempting to sleep I had to deal with the loud window A/C and the domestic argument across the hall. When staying at a hotel you expect to get your wake up call, mine at the Belnord never came; yep, the guy in the morning said "they never put it in and I didn't start until 11pm so it wasn't my fault." Great, thanks, glad it wasn't you... Anyway, when it was finally over, I was happy to be leaving. To top it all off, here I am almost a month later still fighting with them because they charged me for both rooms! Yep, they said that because I was a "no-show" that they charge the full cost of the room. For some reason it's hard for them to realize that someone that booked 2 rooms and checked into one could not have possibly been a "no-show" for the second room. Idiots. Seriously, stay somewhere else, it's the worst place I've ever seen, and I've seen some pretty suspect places before.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected!”
Reviews.Author: freebird74
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd 'budget' hotel experience and I'm giving it an excellent rating inspite of the small, tiny room because overall it's great! The location is perfect in going to times square and central park and anywhere in manhattan! Checking in and out was easy and fast! It has a lot of bathrooms, you don't feel like you're sharing it with anybody. In fact, in my three day stay there I haven't once seen anybody else use it but me and my sister. I also like the fact that they have a full bathroom with tub/shower and toilet and sink and next to it is another restroom if you only need to use the toilet or the sink!! NO need to rush and wake up early just to use the shower! The negatives are the same as in most budget hotels, the sheets/beddings and towels are old and thin so you're better off bringing your own. Bring toiletries too. They don't have free soap and shampoo. (A CVS store is just around the corner if you need anything 24/7). The room has this old, musty, almost stinky smell so bring your own air freshener too! These aren't even complaints because you are in NEW YORK afterall, the most expensive city in the US if not in the world. For the price, this is surely not a dump! I'd definitely come back and tell others of this great find!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here! Seriously!”
Reviews.Author: kleeeeeen
Reviews.Content: Okay, this place was TERRIBLE! I can sleep anywhere and I couldn't sleep there! Hard bed, questionable bedding, VERY small, not clean. This is a hotel that people live in. People were coming and going all night... usually I'd say who cares but the wall are paper thin. I really hated it. Don't be cheap. spend a little extra money and stay somewhere else it'll be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “NO, NO ,NO, NO, NO, DON'T, DON'T, DON'T, DON'T, DON'T”
Reviews.Author: FLORIDAJ&C
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this property about 2 years ago. I was attractred by price and location. I was pleasantly surprised that the accomodations turned out to be adequate and reasonable for Manhattan. THAT was 2 years ago... BOY, is that no longer the case.
