I wish I had read the reviews on this site BEFORE I booked. Yup, it's true. The place is RIDDEN with bed bugs. I had welts all over my arms, legs, and back for about 4 or 5 days. These bites are much larger than mosquito bites and WAY itchy folks!! It's disgusting this place is still in business. I have notified Hotels.com. If they continue to allow this property to advertise on their site going forward, I will lose all respect and trust for Hotels.com as well. You do not want to stay here!!!!!! No one should stay here!!!!!!!! The place should be condemned. HEED, this warning. I am not the competition creating a problem for a competitor. The truth is this hotel has had many complaints and ample time to fix the problem. It's ashame because these bugs are insidious and I imagine it would be costly to treat the entire property thoroughly. However, they will end up going out of business or renting by the hour anyway, at this rate. I have NO doubt.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay at this hotel, no matter how cheap it is!”
Reviews.Author: costaone
Reviews.Content: Well we read the reviews and we didn't pay any attention because we were attracted by the price and location. We've just come back and guess what....there were bedbugs. I'm sitting here right now with about 30+ bites on my body (very itchy and annoying). I've washed all our bedding and vacuumed the bed, plus we are airing the whole apartment. And not forgetting to wash every single piece of clothing we took with us!! The location is fantastic and so is the area the hotel is situated in (safe and very NY). The rooms were really small and there wasn't a view. The staircase is narrow and hot, and if you live on the top floors it's a long way up after a long day of sightseeing. The rooms are cleaned regularly but the airconditioning makes for very artificial living. On the first day we checked the bed for bedbugs.....found none of course. We didn't really research the signs of bedbugs and one of them is little blood stains on the sheets and covers. We found those every day and we never thought anything of it. They also charge you $5 per piece of luggage that you store the day that you leave. It's a little good money earn because you have to check out by 12. Our flight wasn't until late afternoon so we had only booked a car to take us in the early afternoon. We were advised to this by a cabby who told us traffic is murder on the way to the airport. A good car company to book your car, reasonable rates JFK $46 + $4.5 for toll - -- Final word, don't book this hotel no matter what, it isn't worth the money. Remember BEDBUGS are a pain and not at all fun. Think 30+ and growing bites of mosquitoes and then you are getting close to what it's like.

Reviews.Title: “A bit shabby”
Reviews.Author: whites4
Reviews.Content: Any hotel with such a great location must be fairly bad to be priced so cheaply.... and Belnord is. The bad bits: the disgusting stench of stale smoke the tiny room the view of a brick wall (ha ha) the unhelpful (and noisy) staff charging $5 per bag to hold our luggage after check out the carpets and bedding looked a hundred years old, plenty of dust in there! The ok bits (good would be going a bit far as they're actually expected in most normal hotels!): The toilets were cleaned reguarly and always smelt nice The hotel itself seemed fairly clean We didnt have bed bugs So if you just want the room to sleep in and can handle feeling a little bit grubby and unglamorous for your stay then it is fine. We had no major complaints as there was nothing essentially wrong with it. However next time i think i would prefer to pay a little bit extra to stay somewhere less dingy!!

Reviews.Title: “Here's the low-down on the Belnord:”
Reviews.Author: hipworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: My friend and I wanted a weekend getaway to NYC for some shopping & girl time. We didn't want to spend a lot, and I was thrilled to find the Belnord which looked nice and was in a good neighborhood AND less than $100/night, including tax! I booked it, and THEN I read the reviews. Bedbugs, tiny rooms, shared bathrooms. We didn't care that the room was tiny, because lets face it: we didn't come to NYC to sit around our room. The shared bathroom we weren't that concerned about either because we figured we were only gone one night, and if it was really nasty, we'd just wait until we got home the next night to take showers. The bedbug reviews, however, totally freaked me out. I knew I couldn't cancel my reservation, and I knew we couldn't afford any other hotels in decent neighborhoods. My friend's mom made her read 2 articles and watch a video on bedbugs and GAVE HER A QUIZ before we left! She is so funny. I was feeling okay, though, because I had read other reviews about the Belnord that said other people had read the bedbug reviews after booking, had been really freaked out, but had no problems whatsoever. I relaxed. THEN we got to the hotel. It was too early to check in, but the nice guy behind the desk let us leave our luggage in a luggage room while we spent some time sightseeing. While we were at the desk, a girl about our age was checking out of the hotel and said "You might want to look into that room, because I woke up with these bites all over me! Look, I have like 40 bites and I itch like crazy! There's definitely something in that room!" We flipped out. We listened to her say her room number, which was 170-something. We made a mental note in case they tried to give us that room. While we were sightseeing, we tried to come up with a plan. Sleep in bugspray? A scuba suit? Find a dog that was sick with a fever and let it sleep with us, since bedbugs seek out the warmest body??? When we checked in, they did not give us that room. My friend knew what to look for, so as soon as we got to the (tiny) room, we tore it apart. The room was 10 feet by 7 feet, no lie. We didn't care, though, as I said. There was a plastic, zippered matress cover. We undid it and examined the seems for evidence of bedbugs. We took the headboard off the wall because that is another place bedbugs hide during the day. At the Belnord, you can lift the headboard and it comes off easily. No evidence there. We were reassured. The next time we were in the lobby, I said to the desk boy:"Remember that girl who checked out ealier and complained of bedbugs? Do you get that a lot? You can be honest, because I've already paid." He got very flustered and said "I don't know what to say! Maybe she just made that up to get a discount. If you have any problems with your room, we are here 24 hours a day and we will move you, no questions asked." Although it was a little hard to sleep, knowing that there are bedbugs in the hotel, even if not in my room (and because the AC unit scared the mess out of me and woke me up every time it kicked on), we had no problems at all, I am happy to say. BOTTOM LINE: Do your homework before you go. Know what to look for as far as bedbugs are concerned. KNow the signs. Move if you have ANY concerns. They will switch your room for you. I would stay at the Belnord again because it is in a safe area and very convenient to the subway--only one block away and it is very affordable. THe bathrooms were clean and always available. You can always ask for our room, 203-9, because you know at least that one doesn't have bedbugs! Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: cedens1971
Reviews.Content: We had a very good experience at this hotel when we stayed there in June 2005. The air conditioner worked good, the room was clean, and there were no "bed bugs" as other reviewers have complained about. It is in a quiet little neighborhood on the upper west side, just a few blocks from a subway station and Central Park. There are nice restaurants, grocery and drug stores and delis close by. The room is very tiny, but all we used the hotel for was to sleep in so that was not a problem at all. After walking all over NYC it was a nice, cool and comfortable place to rest at the end of the day. There is no elevator and the hallways and stairways are very narrow, so if you are morbidly obese you may want to find another hotel. But if you are that obese then NYC is probably not the place for you since many of the subways are not accessible by electric scooters or wheelchairs.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: buzzlnj
Reviews.Content: When I read all the bugs stories in the reviews after my stay was booked I was horrified. So maybe I just got lucky and got a bugless room but I found the Belnord was a great budget hotel. Ive been to a lot of hotels of the same category in NY and the Belnord was definitely the best one. The hotel was modern, the room looked pretty new and was very clean. There were plenty of bathrooms in the hallway and they were all sparkling. The location is fine too, close to a subway station and Central park. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: psych49
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights in an "Executive double room" for $136/night. The room was quite small, but it is New York City, and it was all we needed for our stay. We opted for a room with a private bathroom, which we found to be very clean. The room had a TV, a desk and chair, a nightstand, and the bed. The staff was friendly and fairly helpful. The location was good, W 84th between Amsterdam and Broadway, a block away from a subway station. Overall, we liked the hotel and thought it was a good value for the money. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Like a european hotel”
Reviews.Author: ERStexellence
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 day stay. We were on the 5th floor, no bugs at all, in fact the place was quite clean. I had not read the reviews prior to leaving or probably would have had the creeps! I stayed at a four star hotel in Boston last year, and three days later a five star hotel in Dallas, and came home with the itches described about bedbugs. Had no idea what was wrong with me, went to doctor, and found out. I did a lot of research on bedbugs after that, and now check when i check into a hotel. Did not have this problem. It is indeed a walk up so the flights of stairs are indeed good exercise (To get to floor 2, is 10 steps, turn, then 8), third floor (and every other floor (9 steps, turn then 8) ..yes I counted. Did not realize it was a walkup when I booked but I would have booked anyway. A staff member helped my fellow traveller with her suitcase. They do have a working ice machine---but you want to get a bag at reception, because you will not want to walk all the way up to the fifth floor to get the ice bucket, then down to fill it, then up again. The staff at the desk always accomodated us with a cellophane bag before we went upstairs. One block from 86th and Broadway subway station (did not know this when we first arrived and we took the Central Park West line and got off on 86th), a lot longer walk. Great 24 hour bread and bagel place around the corner. We went here for a fast and cheap vacation, since Jet Blue from Texas was 79 each way! We were amazed at how high hotels have gotten as it has been several years since I was in NY and used to be able to stay at the Days' Inn for 100-150, we found nothing below 250 when we internet searched several sites, so we took the Belnord at 99 for 4 nights and 79 for the last night (a Monday) Very small room (that's what I mean by european, it reminded me very much of the small rooms I have stayed in in Spain), tv worked, shared bathrooms really clean. They only give you two bath towels and one handtowel for two in a room. The maid one day stopped me and said "propina"...I have no idea what that meant...she took out a dollar bill and rubbed it together in her hand---i surmised she wanted a tip, which I would have left upon check out....but I figured she thought she could get it if she did that. I have never had anyone do that before, and I suppose you could play the same game as she did (don't understand the language), and ignore the request if you wanted to. She was attentive to our room, so it didn't really bother me to do it, just the request was a bit forward, i thought. One of the reception clerks was rude to one of the people I travelled with, but the rest were very professioanl and urbane. Professionally dressed, well groomed, and polite. I had no problems that way. I felt safe at this hotel, and slept incredibly well. I thought the acoustics were great. I heard there was a sick baby near us that was crying in the hall one night---I never heard a thing,a nd I was awake at the time that happened. Again, not fancy AT ALL, and if you get a bug free room as we did, this is a good value for a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and Good Location, Perfect for Students !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are two international exchange students in Chicago, and we really wanted to see New York during Spring Break, but couldn't afford something expensive to sleep in. So we checked on the web and found the Belnord, who offered GREAT rebates : $45 per night for two people !!!! We didn't even hesitate and booked a room right away ! Then....we saw the reviews...and we were kind of....worried ! The "bedbugs" problem scared us actually, and we could not cancel. Finally, everything was perfectly ok. It is perfectly situated, clean, very simple. The staff is very civil, we asked them to wake us up early and they did it exactly at the time we wanted. There is no lift, but we didn't have heavy luggage, so it was not a big deal for us. The room was cleaned everyday, and we could even go on the internet on the lower level. And No bedbugs ! We checked very carefully every night, it was ok. I recommend this hotel to those who want to save money and spend it on something else. If you expect somthing above the top, don't go there. It isn't a place to hang out, even if you have the tv. But if you are here to take sights and go places, it is perfect !!!!! Especially the location, one block away from the subway. For this, the hotel worths its 4 stars....

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel, I recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend were there for a April week-end. The check-in wasn't to be made untill 2h00pm but they had a room where we could leave our luggages and a washroom that we could use for the time being, which was appreciated. The staff was okay. Nothing special, respectful and neutral. The rooms were a little small but then again, you're in New York! You're not going to spend your days in the room. ;-) The bathrooms were -very- clean. They sure did a great job! As for the bedbugs mentionned in the other posts, there wasn't any in our bed. And I'm guessing that even the best hotels got them... so there you go. No worries about it. The high point of this place is it's location. Next to Central Park and to a Metro lane. It's only a walk away from the Metropolitain Museum of art. And not to mention that Broadway is a couple of streets after with some good restaurants. (I highly reccomend "City Dinner" on Broadway and the 90th avenue which offer a 24hour casual restaurant service! Very appreciated after you've seen a musical!:-) ) Other than that, we enjoyed our little stay. It is perfect for budget-minded travellers and for young couples who happens to also be budget-minded. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Lots of potential, but...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It looks it's hit or miss with this place, but unfortunately I was hit. I thought I had escaped unscathed until I returned home and have been dealing with bug bites for the last week. My buddy who stayed in the next bed over is apparently fine. It's too bad, because the location and price were great, and I am generally fine staying in a hotel without all the amenities. I would stay again in the same area, but pay a little more for a safer hotel. It can happen anywhere, but doesn't seem to be a fluke at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz, Better Than a Trailer”
Reviews.Author: AustinTownies
Reviews.Content: Small rooms (I mean small), clean bathrooms, amazing location, moderate night noise, no bed bugs (in our room), average staff. We just use hotels for sleeping, so we actually enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “It was great-until...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: OK here's the scoop. My mom and I received this trip to NYC as a gift from my dad. The Belnord was where we were to stay. When I found these reviews and shared with my mom, we were terrified of what we'd find. We decided to brave it so we wouldn't hurt my dad's feelings. We stayed from March 17-20. The location of The Belnord was good. Just off of Broadway with lots of shops and places to eat. One block from the subway and very close to Central Park. We had a room with 2 beds and a private bath. We were on the first floor, so didn't have to lug our stuff up the stairs. I highly recommend getting a "bigger and better" room. The room was small, but met our needs easily. Had a window with a view and the heating system, TV worked fine. The room and bathroom were spotless and were kept that way each day. The shared bathrooms sparkled as well, and I never noticed a line. It seemed there were plenty of them. The staff was friendly and helpful and got everything we needed and included smiles and manners. Now what you REALLY want to know. The bedbugs. When we arrived on Friday we thoroughly examined the bed and room with no signs of the bugs. Each night when I'd happen to wake up, I would check the bed to make sure and no bugs. We were convinced that after staying three nights, there were no bugs, atleast in our room. That was until the last morning. When my mom got up from her bed, there sure enough was a bedbug! Talk about disappointing. Very creepy. Only glad that we hadn't seen this when we first got there-it would have been impossible to stay there had we known for sure. This review is hard to write, as I feel that for the price it is overall a great place to stay. It was really perfect for our needs. They just really need to get this bug problem under control. Though if you research bedbugs, you will find that even some of the finer hotels experience them.

Reviews.Title: “Genuine budget accommodation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Belnord for just 4 days at the end of February 2006. I paid around US$70 per night, as there was a special on for the winter season. Overall I was satisfied with what I received. My room was quite small, cosy, with a small television and a narrow wardrobe. There was also no elevator but it's not like everyday you have to tote luggage up the flight of stairs. As it was winter and freezing outside, I spent a lot of time indoors. I had no complaints about the heating, shared bathrooms (which were always clean), or the traffic outside (I was on the 3rd floor and I didn't even hear it). My only complaint - & thinking back it could have been a serious one - was the heater which make a loud noise at times, sometimes late at night, and made me wake up a few times. Had I planned to spend a longer time, I would have asked for a change of rooms. On the upside, I found the staff to be very friendly and willing, even those who had trouble speaking English. These are mainly the maids and handymen. If you're a student looking for an economical place located within easy access to the heart of the what makes New York, New York, this could be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this one! Please!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Im a pretty easy going person. Ive stayed at a lot of hostels around the world and non were half as bad as this hotel. The tiny room barely fit a full size bed. It was about as large as my walk in closet!).The room was cold and The tv was broken - the only way of turning it off was unplugging it-So just image how relaxing that was. Around 6am the showers started in the shared bathroom next to the room so needless to say that ended my relaxing tossing and turning for the night. When I got the chance to use the bathroom it was all wet and full of soaked towels and ugly scum. I did not take a shower that day of course. The last straw was to find out I had slept with an army of bed bugs under me. My body starts itching every time I remember. When I complained I got offered to change rooms but I was Done with that place and called a cab. I had booked it thru Woogle (no clue)so it was impossible to get my money back. Please avoid this one. I ended up in a hotel in Chelsea for the same price. I really think they should close that place. It's really a shame that the reviews show any good ratings - It's the worst place I have ever been to!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from 26th-30th December with my girlfriend. The room was reasonably priced for the time of year ($150 a night, compared with $100 for a private room at a youth hostel!). The private bathroom was small, with occasionally tempremental hot water, but clean. There were no bed bugs, and the room was cleaned every day, even when we left late late morning. There was no view, but then as others have said if you are staying in New York you are not going to be staying in your hotel room all the time. The room was on the ground floor, so we weren't affected by the lack of an elevator. Staff were competent and helpful. Heating/air con worked fine. I'm puzzled by how the reviews for this hotel can be so mixed! Personally I would recommend it as a great place to stay for a budget conscious couple.

Reviews.Title: “The worst of the worst”
Reviews.Author: cincinnatirocks
Reviews.Content: Are you one of those people thinking: "It can't be that bad hotel as the worst reviews are saying- surely I'll find it good enough for my needs". Tick tock, it's about time to change that way of thinking at least when it comes to Belnord. I've stayed in dozens of hotels in USA and this is the worst I have come across. I'm not into luxury and usually am entertained what comes to problems with hotels- but Belnord makes even all the hotel comedy series look lame and definitely boring. The question is will you be ready to pay for this fun? I booked via ---- for six nights in January 2006 and paid in advance so there was a little risk of finding the hotel unbearable. Opening the room door convinced me already of troubles. After putting the lights on I lowered the window blinds just to find out they were not long enough to cover the long windows even if you tried adjusting them. There goes the privacy. The other window had been fixed with tape to keep it in place while the upper part of it had a broomstick put across to prevent opening it from the other side. There goes the safety. The view from the window included a tall brick wall and garbage containers. By this time I had also noticed the loud noise which reminded me of a truck parked right on the backyard with its motor running. The sound of traffic I can take but this sound of something much louder than any air conditioning system was very irritating. It stopped after the midnight but just for some hours. There goes the peace. Then came the cold. I come from Finland where temperatures go easily down to minus degrees but never in my life have I felt such an intense cold as in my room. The heating unit wouldn't work and when I explained the situation in the reception a spanish speaking man came to see about it. I tried telling him I've been working on the heater for hours but he said couldn't understand english at all. First he asked for ten minutes so I patiently waited for a miracle to happen. Then the man suddenly stood up claiming the AC unit was hot which it wasn't. For this simple word "hot" I had something to say back "not hot or even warm". The man looked careless about the whole thing and simply mumbled "I'm sorry". We walked back to the reception area but the hotel staff only wanted to hear what the man had to say- of which I didn't understand a word as it was all in spanish. I got an extra blanket- I almost caught a flu too on the following night. Six nights- such a long time when returning to the hotel was almost undesirable. I would go there for just to sleep and then get off first thing in the morning. I don't like writing in a bad --- style like this but every hotel is only as good as the worst it has to offer to its customers. Ruining or even harming somebody's business is not my intention but finding something good about Belnord is quite impossible. Belnord makes sleeping on the street a good option. You have been warned- I didn't believe the worst things people came up with but maybe you should.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: jalowen
Reviews.Content: No bedbugs and helpful staff. OK there is no elevator, so we did have to carry our bags up 5 floors - however they had offered to help. Bathroom clean, great location. Couldn't ask for a better hotel at this price.

Reviews.Title: “Better off sleeping on the street!!!!”
Reviews.Author: carlosndana954
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at this hotel from Dec 2-6 2005. Right before we arrived at the hotel we saw the reviews that there were bed bugs and had only hoped that they had taken care of the problem before we checked in. We were totally wrong the first night we were there we found one on the bed and went down to the office and asked for a new room but they acted like they didn't even know they had the bed bugs! I mean after the 10 reviews of people saying they complained about bed bugs how could they not know. So then they offered to give me another room on the 4th floor without a private bathroom eventhough I paid for one with a private bathroom. So when i said they would have to refund the difference they said we'll see what we can do. So before I carried all of our luggage up to the 4th floor since there is no elevator i asked my mom to go up and check the room. When she turned on the light she immidiately found a huge bedbug on the bed and brought it down to the front desk and they still did not offer any assistance. We went to NY on one of the busiest weeks and there were no other vacancies so we were forced to sleep there! We bought a plastic cover for the bed, moved the bed to the middle of the room, and slept with the lights on every night. We felt like we were on "SURVIVOR" taking turns sleeping. The bathroom was clean but the room was run down and there were bed bug egg shells everywhere. Everynight we killed at least 2 that were on the carpet and on the walls. Rude staff who didn't know anything. Nice location but they need to close this hotel down for about a month and exterminate they have an infestation! If i could rate this hotel with no stars i would but that option is not available! Sleep outside with the bugs and save your money, if you are going to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Very decent value for the budget conscious”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok, let's be frank here, the Belnord is NOT the Waldorf-Astoria or the Plaza.My wife and I usually stay in properties closer to Times Square but $450+ per night prices post-Thanksgiving just were not in the budget. I'd read a few reviews of this hotel prior to booking and had a few reservations about my reservations but those were pretty much erased upon arrival. The Belnord is in a very nice "Upper West Side" location and super convenient to the subway and bus*. ONLY WARNING: NO ELEVATORS! Suitcases up narrow stairs to fifth floor was our exercise for the weekend!! Our (private bath) room was "cozy" but fine as we were only there to lay our heads. (You're in New York! You don't stay in your rooms to watch TV!) Neighhood has several decent small restaurants and a full-service CVS Pharmacy is a block away. *Bus M86 is cross-town (through Central Park) and drops you right beside Metropolitan Museum of Art. We would stay there again if prices mid-town were out-of-budget.

Reviews.Title: “I Love The HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I have seen the reviews on the site, i was affraid to go to this Hotel! Everyone talk about Bedbugs.... I have stayed in the hotel in the end of November and it was a great hotel! It was a very nice room, not very big, but it was okay! A great bathroom. We had everything for ourself! The rooms were every morning clean up! We have go every morning in to New York City and in the evening we get back! The Staff was very nice and friendly! So for everyone, stay in this hotel, it's very great!!!!!! :D:D

Reviews.Title: “be warned”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location wss great but for November the rooms were cold because the heating was not on. I asked when it would be on and was told it would come on automatically when the weather got cold. My room was cold throughout my stay of 7 days. My travel bag went missing from the room I stored it in after checking out and before leaving for the airport. When I returned to collect my bag and found it missing the staff just said there was nothing they could do about it. I would have thought if another guest had taken it by mistake that when that person returned to get the correct bag the staff would at least have enquired as to whether my bag had been taken in error. There was no offer to do that or anything to help me. I left without my bag and have not seen it since. As it contained all the purchases I had made in New York it was a disaster and a very sad end to what was otherwise a lovely holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were rude, didn't even have us booked in to the hotel when we arrived. We were given a tiny room we did not pay for, no view out of the window except for a brick wall. Only 2 bathrooms per whole floor. There were bed bugs found in the bed. I have read other cases, and i too had itchy lumps on my legs and arms for over 2 weeks. Please don't waste your money here, it's not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Andi_Westmoreland
Reviews.Content: Great little gem in the Upper West Side! The price is very affordable, room was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “All rooms has been treated”
Reviews.Author: emmainindia
Reviews.Content: I've read all the reviews below regarding the bed-bugs problems. I myself have stayed in the hotel 3 times in the last 2 months and am very pleased with what I get for my money. Since the manager of the hotel and I have become acquainted lately, she assured me that all the rooms have been treated against bug by the best exterminator in NY. That guy was around on one of the mornings when I left the room and he told me that all the hotels in NY are suffering from bed-bugs at the moment, even the big places (I don't know if I’m allowed to say names on this website...). I know for sure that I am coming back to the Belnord and I can recommend this to anyone who wants to stay in the lovely area between the Hudson River and Central Park. Wishing you all pleasant journeys, Linda

Reviews.Title: “Run for your Life”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING I was a bedbug feast. I thought it was a spider and complained. The clerk agreed it must be a spider. The next day I had more bites and didn't know they were bedbugs until the 3rd day. By then I was covered, hands, head, arms upper body. Disgusting and the clerk told me maybe it was mosquitos although the temp outside was in the 40's. (so they lie, too) Thank goodness we left and found another hotel once I knew what was happening. But its been a week and I'm still itching and allergic to the bites so I'm breaking out in hives, too. No fun. DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL!! YOU WILL BE SORRY AND THEY DO NOT CARE. IT WAS HORRIBLE.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most reasonably priced hotels that we found. We got the room with its own bathroom. It was pretty quiet & the area is safe. The room is very small. There was little room from the edges of the bed to the walls and the TV was on a stand hanging from the ceiling. We didn't see any bugs, though. There are no elevators in the hotel so we had to walk up 5 floors (that's where they put us) everytime we came in and out of the room. BUT it met our needs and it was well within our budget. So we got to spend more money on food, gifts, etc. And we were out and about most of the time. We really only came back to shower & sleep. The customer service that we received from the helpdesk was not good. But they did hold our luggage after checkout for a few hours while we went out to eat. It took us about 10-15 minutes to get to time square from the time we left our hotel door to the time we got to time sq. So if you plan to spend lots of time in the room (which I hope you don't if you are on a personal vacation because there are lots of things to do), then you may get frustrated with the small space and poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away for A While”
Reviews.Author: FrugalTraveler50
Reviews.Content: There is a bedbug problem....even if the place is quiet and clean no one wants unexpected visitors of this kind. It has a great location being only a block from a subway stop. The private and public bathrooms were spotless but the bug problem makes this a place to avoid. Sad as my room looked like it had recently been refurbhished and was the cleanest hotel room I have ever seen. For the money it would have been a great deal but because of the bug problem this place must be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “great for the price”
Reviews.Author: Cruz619
Reviews.Content: i read some of these reviews so i was a little afraid when i first got to the belnord. Although small, the rooms were very clean and no bed bugs in my room. The bathrooms were clean and kept that way our entire stay. I had a great time in New York and this place is so close to everything. I would definitely stay here again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, there are bedbugs....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A week after our stay in the Belnord Hotel, I'm fighting against bedbugs at home. Yes, they do travel home with you and it is such a nuisance to get rid of those buggers - not to mention the antibiotics I have to take as the bites have infected... I got bitten on our last two nights there, and now that I brought them home, they are having a feast. The bedbugs epidemic is very unfortunate, because othwerwise we would have been very happy with Belnord: it's amazingly reasonably priced for a NYC hotel, location is good, our room (twin with private bath) was comfortable and quite spacious, and we found the personnel to be friendly. So I truly hope they will get rid of the bugs!!!

Reviews.Title: “those bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: Stina_on_her_travels
Reviews.Content: i kind of feel for this hotel as i think they know they have bedbugs, i mean the beds aren't very old - at least mine wasn't - but they're in the fabric of that place. i didn't actually ask to be moved as i killed a bug on my first morning (so full of my blood it wasn't moving very fast across the bed - so engorged it just exploded into a blood spot on impact!) and i hoped maybe that was my bed bug. but i killed another the day after! in fact, check out ur sheets and u'll see small washed out blood spot stains on them. actually i don't know why i feel for this hotel because their idea of cleaning is to dowse the place with shake'n'vac (or maybe it's bug killer and i breathed it in for 3 nights) and hoover it up again. the bathroom was clean enough - and a communal one too. but considering i have backpacked around asia and this is the worst place i've stayed in, i think that says a lot. it smelled of wee and brasso and was cell like and i just felt like i breathed no fresh air the whole time i was in there. i will say one thing - i complained to hotels and they gave me some financial compensation - maybe it was cos i offered to send them one of the bugs i'd preserved in sellotape! so thumbs up to hotels and thumbs down to the belnord.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Within 24 hours we had been allocated 3 different rooms. We had to sleep in the first room for one night as they did not have one available with a bathroom, although that is what we had paid for. On the second night in a different room, while lying on the bed, my husband was bitten by bedbugs on his hands, wrists and shoulders, which caused large swellings and blisters. He immediately went down to reception to complain and was given keys for a third room, and so we had to gather all our belongings and move again. No one seemed at all concerned and at no time were we offered an apology or any recompense. Altogether staying at this hotel was a dreadful experience and quite ruined our holiday. We would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good and reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Belnord is a modest but reasonably priced hotel. The rooms were clean and well maintained. Our room contained a bathroom including shower and bathtub. The room also contained a TV and phone. There is no elevator, which can be a problem if you are carrying a lot of luggage. Hotel staff were pleasant. Hotel lobby contains an internet kiosk, phones, vending machines. There is no internet wireless, which is advertised on some sites. Belnord is located near subways, restaurants and shops. I would recommend it to travellers looking for a hotel, which is affordable and centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs 3”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Belnord hotel and I had the worst experience in my life. First the hotel seems right except some little things(no lift..) but on the last two nights I was biten by the bugs at least 50 times. My arms, my neck, legs were full of bites. IT'S NOT A JOKE SO AVOID THIS HOTEL IF YOU WANT TO ENJOY YOUR TRIP.

Reviews.Title: “Probably not again”
Reviews.Author: travelbarb
Reviews.Content: Called hotel to reconfirm day before arrival. No record of reservation made with Hotels. Several phone calls to Belnord and Hotels and 30 minutes later it was confirmed. Don't know who was at fault, but my guess would be Belnord. They are very confused group. We arrived at hotel at 1PM. Naturally, room not ready, left luggage in unsecure room (they give key to everyone to just go and pick up their luggage). Returned at 6:45 hoping for quick check-in, shower and leave for theater by 7:30. Key card did not work. Back to desk. Person #1 came to see what was wrong. Did not work. Back to desk. Person #2 came to check it out. Did not work. Person #3 came to check it out. Did not work. Back to desk. Call maintenance man for real key. Maintenance man said room no good - it was a storage room. Back to desk. New room. Card did not work. Maintenance man used key, but room was occupied -- good thing -- a/c barely working. New room -- 4th floor -- no elevator - but key card worked. Whole procedure took 40 minutes. No apology. Room acceptable, a/c okay, bathroom acceptable (toilet needed to be flushed from inside tank -- reported first night and still broken 2 days later). Not a bug in sight.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs2!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at this hotel and had the worst experience. I booked a single room with a private bath and woke in the middle of the night with my bed full of bedbugs. I was transferred to a tiny room with no bathroom, still full of insects. Of course, although I spent the night in a room cheaper than the one I had paid for, the hotel staff did not give me any reimbursement or solution. I would only recommend this hotel if you are fond of sleeping with bedbugs!

Reviews.Title: “What more do you need?”
Reviews.Author: Mariner71
Reviews.Content: We found this place online 2 days prior to visiting NYC as we ran into an unexpected need for a hotel. The hotel is perfectly situated between Amsterdam and Broadway on 87th Street within walking distance of some great restaurants and bars as well as shopping and, of course, the metro line. The rooms were small...I mean small with a small bathroom, but everything was very clean. As you don't visit NYC to stay in your hotel room, it was a perfect place to throw down the bags and get some rest at night. Beds were comfy, TV worked fine...no complaints. The service was fine. One drawback and only because we had a lot of luggage...no elevator. But a little exercise never hurt anyone! Save money for other expensive NYC stuff...great place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Cheap Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zx1234
Reviews.Content: I am a low maintenance traveler. This is a low cost hotel. What that means is don't expect any frills. This hotel is very clean, located in a good neighborhood, restaurants nearby, and close to the subway. The rooms are very small. We had a double bedroom and it was very small with a shared bathroom. The bathrooms were very clean and we never had to wait for them. There is no elevator. If you need service or want someone to wait on you this is not the place. However, if you are looking for a low cost, clean place to sleep then this is a good choice.
